sentences.english: Redfern stunned the crowd with a last-minute goal.
sentences.chinese: 雷德芬在最后一分钟进球，使观众很是震惊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使震惊， 使目瞪口呆； 把…打昏， 使昏迷
detailed_translations.english: to surprise or upset someone so much that they do not react immediately

name: volt
trans: n. 伏特（电压单位）；环骑；闪避 n. (Volt)人名；(捷)沃尔特

sentences.english: That is one electron volt.
sentences.chinese: 就是一单位的电子伏特。

sentences.english: If I multiply these two, what is the coulomb times a volt?
sentences.chinese: 如果我把这两个乘起来，库仑乘以伏特是多少？

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring the force of an electric current

name: access
trans: n. 通道；进入；机会；使用权；探望权；（对计算机存储器的）访问；（情感）爆发 v. 接近，使用；访问，存取（电脑文档） adj. （电视节目或时间等）对外公开的

sentences.english: Access is by means of a small door on the right.
sentences.chinese: 入口是右边的一扇小门。

detailed_translations.chinese: 接近；通道，入口；接近的机会
detailed_translations.english: the way you use to enter a building or reach a place
to find information, especially on a computer

name: efficient
trans: adj. 有效率的；有能力的；生效的

sentences.english: a very efficient secretary
sentences.chinese: 效率高的秘书

sentences.english: an efficient use of land
sentences.chinese: 土地的有效使用

sentences.english: Lighting is now more energy efficient.
sentences.chinese: 如今的照明设备更加节能。

detailed_translations.english: if someone or something is efficient, they work well without wasting time, money, or energy

name: exceptional
trans: adj. 异常的，例外的 n. 超常的学生

sentences.english: an exceptional student
sentences.chinese: 出类拔萃的学生

sentences.english: A review panel concluded that there were no exceptional circumstances that would warrant a lesser penalty for him.
sentences.chinese: 一个评估小组作出结论：没有什么例外情况可使他获得从轻惩罚。

detailed_translations.english: unusually good

name: expensive
trans: adj. 昂贵的；花钱的

sentences.english: the most expensive restaurant in town
sentences.chinese: 城里最贵的餐馆

sentences.english: Petrol is becoming more and more expensive.
sentences.chinese: 汽油越来越贵了。

sentences.english: Photography is an expensive hobby.
sentences.chinese: 摄影是一项很花钱的业余爱好。

sentences.english: For low-income families, children’s safety equipment can be prohibitively expensive (= so expensive that most people cannot afford it ).
sentences.chinese: 对于低收入家庭来说，儿童的安全设备贵得让人望而却步。

sentences.english: Employing the wrong builder can be a horribly expensive mistake.
sentences.chinese: 用错建筑工人有时会是代价高昂的错误。

sentences.english: Her husband had expensive tastes (= liked expensive things ).
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫喜欢的东西都很贵。

detailed_translations.english: costing a lot of money

name: prosper
trans: vi. 繁荣，昌盛；成功 vt. 使……成功；使……昌盛；使……繁荣 n. (Prosper)人名；(英、德、罗、法)普罗斯珀

sentences.english: His business continued to prosper.
sentences.chinese: 他的生意持续兴隆。

detailed_translations.english: If people or businesses prosper, they are successful and do well

name: transportation
trans: n. 运输；运输系统；运输工具；流放

sentences.english: The city needs to improve its public transportation (= buses, trains etc ) .
sentences.chinese: 这座城市需要改善公共交通。

detailed_translations.english: a system or method for carrying passengers or goods from one place to another

name: cabinet
trans: n. 内阁；橱柜；展览艺术品的小陈列室 adj. 内阁的；私下的，秘密的

sentences.english: The President chose loyal supporters to serve in his cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 总统选择了忠诚的支持者到他的内阁服务。

sentences.english: Every year we used the State of the Union as an organizing tool for the cabinet and staff to come up with new policy ideas, and then we worked hard on how best to present them.
sentences.chinese: 每年国情咨文都被内阁和幕僚们作为我们提出新政策思路的一个组织工具，然后我们努力下功夫，让它们以最佳方式呈现在人们面前。

detailed_translations.english: the politicians with important positions in a government who meet to make decisions or advise the leader of the government

name: executive
trans: adj. 经营管理的；有执行权的；高级的；供重要人物使用的 n. 主管；行政领导；（政府的）行政部门；执行委员会

sentences.english: a commission with executive powers
sentences.chinese: 有执行权的委员会

detailed_translations.english: relating to the job of managing a business or organization and making decisions
a group of people who are in charge of an organization and make the rules

name: federal
trans: adj. 联邦的；同盟的；联邦政府的； 联邦制的 adv. 联邦政府地 n. (Federal)人名；(英)费德勒尔

sentences.english: Switzerland is a federal republic.
sentences.chinese: 瑞士是一个联邦共和国。

detailed_translations.english: a federal country or system of government consists of a group of states which control their own affairs, but which are also controlled by a single national government which makes decisions on foreign affairs, defence etc

name: impeachment
trans: n. 弹劾；控告；怀疑；指摘

sentences.english: There are grounds for impeachment.
sentences.chinese: 有数个弹劾的理由。

detailed_translations.english: The impeachment of a senior official is the process of charging them with a crime that makes them unfit for office

name: pardon
trans: n. 原谅；赦免；宽恕 vt. 原谅；赦免；宽恕 n. (Pardon)人名；(德、法、捷)帕尔东

sentences.english: He craved the teacher's pardon.
sentences.chinese: 他恳求老师原谅他。

sentences.english: I earnestly pray for your pardon.
sentences.chinese: 我恳切地请求你原谅。

sentences.english: I hope you will pardon me for doing so.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你原谅我这样做。

detailed_translations.english: to forgive someone for behaving badly
used to say ‘sorry’ after you have made an impolite sound such as a  burp

name: veto
trans: n. 否决权 vt. 否决；禁止 vi. 否决；禁止

sentences.english: The Senate had a sufficient majority to override the presidential veto (= not accept his refusal ).
sentences.chinese: 参议院有足够的多数票可以推翻总统的否决。

detailed_translations.english: a refusal to give official permission for something, or the right to refuse to give such permission
if someone in authority vetoes something, they refuse to allow it to happen, especially something that other people or organizations have agreed

name: craftsmanship
trans: n. 技术；技艺

sentences.english: high standards of craftsmanship
sentences.chinese: 很高的工艺水准

detailed_translations.english: the special skill that someone uses to make something beautiful with their hands

name: czar
trans: n. （帝俄的）沙皇，皇帝；独裁者

name: exquisite
trans: adj. 精致的；细腻的；优美的，高雅的；异常的；剧烈的 n. 服饰过于讲究的男子

sentences.english: the most exquisite craftsmanship
sentences.chinese: 最精美的工艺

detailed_translations.chinese: 精致的；细腻的；优美的，高雅的；异常的；剧烈的
detailed_translations.english: extremely beautiful and very delicately made

name: imperial
trans: adj. 帝国的；皇帝的；至高无上的；威严的 n. 纸张尺寸；特等品 n. (Imperial)人名；(西)因佩里亚尔

sentences.english: Britain’s imperial expansion in the 19th century
sentences.chinese: 19世纪英帝国的扩张

detailed_translations.english: relating to an empire or to the person who rules it

name: miniature
trans: adj. 微型的，小规模的 n. 缩图；微型画；微型图画绘画术 vt. 是…的缩影

sentences.english: She’s her mother in miniature.
sentences.chinese: 她是她母亲的缩影。

sentences.english: a miniature railway
sentences.chinese: 微型铁路

detailed_translations.english: exactly like something or someone but much smaller
much smaller than normal

name: Russia
trans: n. 俄罗斯

sentences.english: This program is beamed at Russia.
sentences.chinese: 这套节目是对俄罗斯广播的。

sentences.english: That transmitter was beamed at Russia.
sentences.chinese: 那台发射机曾用于对俄罗斯广播。

sentences.english: He was doubling for America and Russia.
sentences.chinese: 他给美国和俄罗斯当双重间谍。

name: diversity
trans: n. 多样性；差异

sentences.english: ...the cultural diversity of Latin America.
sentences.chinese: …拉丁美洲文化的多样性。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of including many different types of people or things

name: ecology
trans: n. 生态学；社会生态学

sentences.english: the natural ecology of the Earth
sentences.chinese: 地球的自然生态

sentences.english: plant ecology
sentences.chinese: 植物生态学

detailed_translations.english: the way in which plants, animals, and people are related to each other and to their environment, or the scientific study of this

name: naturalist
trans: n. 自然主义者；博物学者；（英）动物标本剥制者；买卖玩赏动物的商人 adj. 自然的（等于naturalistic）；自然主义的；博物学的

sentences.english: I am sometimes described as a naturalist.
sentences.chinese: 有时我也被称作自然主义者。

sentences.english: An American naturalist wrote:"a patriot must always be ready to defend his country against its government".
sentences.chinese: 一位美国自然主义者写道：“爱国者要随时准备好为了保卫国家而与政府斗争！”

sentences.english: To illustrate this, let me refer to the naturalist science of the 19th century, and the effects it had on our opinions of life.
sentences.chinese: 为了诠释这点，我要引用下19世纪的自然主义科学及其它对我们的生活观念所产生的影响。

name: refuge
trans: n. 避难；避难所；庇护 vt. 给予…庇护；接纳…避难 vi. 避难；逃避

sentences.english: a wildlife refuge
sentences.chinese: 野生动物保护区

detailed_translations.english: shelter or protection from someone or something

name: specimen
trans: n. 样品，样本；标本

sentences.english: a blood specimen
sentences.chinese: 血样

detailed_translations.english: a small amount or piece that is taken from something, so that it can be tested or examined

name: discriminate
trans: vt. 歧视；区别；辨别 vi. 区别；辨别

sentences.english: Under federal law, it is illegal to discriminate against minorities and women.
sentences.chinese: 联邦法律规定，歧视少数民族和妇女是违法的。

sentences.english: He is incapable of discriminating between a good idea and a terrible one.
sentences.chinese: 他没能力在一个好主意和一个坏主意之间进行区分。

detailed_translations.english: to treat a person or group differently from another in an unfair way

name: inspire
trans: vt. 激发；鼓舞；启示；产生；使生灵感

sentences.english: We need someone who can inspire the team.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要一个能鼓舞团队士气的人。

sentences.english: Inspired by the sunny weather, I decided to explore the woods.
sentences.chinese: 阳光明媚的天气令人振奋，我决定到森林里寻幽探胜。

sentences.english: The story was inspired by a chance meeting with an old Russian duke.
sentences.chinese: 这个故事的创作灵感来自与一位俄国老公爵的不期而遇。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage someone by making them feel confident and eager to do something

name: nonviolence
trans: n. 非暴力；非暴力事件

name: political
trans: adj. 政治的；党派的

sentences.english: a monarch without political power
sentences.chinese: 没有政治权力的君主

sentences.english: He was a political prisoner (= one who was put in prison because he was thought to be harmful to the state) .
sentences.chinese: 他曾是个政治犯。

detailed_translations.english: connected with the state, government or public affairs

name: protest
trans: n. 抗议，反对；（多来自公证人）拒付证书 v. 抗议，反对；坚决表示，断言；拒付

sentences.english: ‘I don’t see why I should take the blame for this!’ she protested.
sentences.chinese: “我不明白为什么我要对此承担责任！”她抗议道。

detailed_translations.english: to come together to publicly express disapproval or opposition to something
something that you do to show publicly that you think that something is wrong and unfair, for example taking part in big public meetings, refusing to work, or refusing to buy a company’s products

name: unjust
trans: adj. 不公平的，不公正的；非正义的

sentences.english: unjust laws
sentences.chinese: 不公正的法律

detailed_translations.chinese: 不公平的，不公正的；非正义的
detailed_translations.english: not fair or reasonable

name: electricity
trans: n. 电力；电流；强烈的紧张情绪

sentences.english: The farm was very isolated, but it had electricity.
sentences.chinese: 那个农场非常偏远，但有电力供应。

detailed_translations.english: the power that is carried by wires, cables etc, and is used to provide light or heat, to make machines work etc

name: engineer
trans: n. 工程师；工兵；火车司机 vt. 设计；策划；精明地处理 vi. 设计；建造

sentences.english: He trained as a civil engineer (= one who designs and builds roads, bridges etc ).
sentences.chinese: 他接受过土木工程师培训。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to design or build roads, bridges, machines etc

name: experiment
trans: n. 实验，试验；尝试 v. 尝试；试验；进行实验

sentences.english: The teacher provided some different materials and left the children to experiment.
sentences.chinese: 老师提供了几种不同的材料让孩子们试验。

detailed_translations.english: to try using various ideas, methods etc to find out how good or effective they are
a scientific test done to find out how something reacts under certain conditions, or to find out if a particular idea is true

name: investor
trans: n. 投资者

sentences.english: The main investor in the project is the French bank Credit National.
sentences.chinese: 该项目的主要投资方是法国国民信贷银行。

detailed_translations.english: someone who gives money to a company, business, or bank in order to get a profit

name: patent
trans: n. 专利权；专利证；专利品 adj. 专利的；特许生产或销售的；显著的；公开的；（脉管等）开放的 v. 取得……的专利权；授予专利

sentences.english: a patent lock
sentences.chinese: 专利锁

sentences.english: He held a number of patents for his many innovations.
sentences.chinese: 他为他的许多革新申请了几项专利。

detailed_translations.english: protected by a patent
A patent is an official right to be the only person or company allowed to make or sell a new product for a certain period of time.

name: flexible
trans: adj. 灵活的；柔韧的；易弯曲的

sentences.english: We can be flexible about your starting date.
sentences.chinese: 你具体从哪天开始，我们可以灵活一点。

sentences.english: The government needs a more flexible approach to education.
sentences.chinese: 政府在处理教育问题上需要更加灵活。

detailed_translations.english: a person, plan etc that is flexible can change or be changed easily to suit any new situation

name: quadriceps
trans: n. [解剖] 四头肌

name: awe
trans: n. 敬畏，惊叹；（古）使人敬畏的力量 v. 使敬畏，使赞叹 n. (Awe) （美、尼日利亚、英、德）阿韦（人名）

sentences.english: The girls were awed by the splendour of the cathedral.
sentences.chinese: 女孩们对大教堂的宏伟气势大为惊叹。

detailed_translations.english: if you are awed by someone or something, you feel great respect and liking for them, and are often slightly afraid of them
a feeling of great respect and liking for someone or something

name: biography
trans: n. 传记；档案；个人简介

sentences.english: ...recent biographies of Stalin.
sentences.chinese: …近年的斯大林传记。

detailed_translations.english: a book that tells what has happened in someone’s life, written by someone else

name: science fiction
trans: 科幻小说

sentences.english: So real that some people are asking whether science fiction should now be converted into science fact.
sentences.chinese: 同样现实的是很多人疑问是否科幻小说现在应该转换成科技事实了。

sentences.english: This scene is science fiction now, but it might not be for much longer.
sentences.chinese: 现在这种情景仅仅是科幻小说，但不久的将来很可能成为现实。

detailed_translations.english: stories about events in the future which are affected by imaginary developments in science, for example about travelling in time or to other  planets  with life on them

name: transport
trans: n. 运输；运输机；狂喜；流放犯 vt. 运输；流放；使狂喜

sentences.english: trucks used for transporting oil
sentences.chinese: 运输石油的卡车

sentences.english: Canals were used for the transport of goods.
sentences.chinese: 利用运河来运输货物。

detailed_translations.english: to take goods, people etc from one place to another in a vehicle
the process or business of taking goods from one place to another

name: western
trans: adj. 西方的，西部的；有西方特征的 n. 西方人；西部片，西部小说 n. (Western)人名；(英)韦斯顿

sentences.english: the western end of the bay
sentences.chinese: 海湾的西端

sentences.english: Western Australia
sentences.chinese: 西澳大利亚

detailed_translations.chinese: 西方的，西部的；有西方特征的
detailed_translations.english: in or from the west of a country or area

detailed_translations.chinese: 西方人；西部片，西部小说
detailed_translations.english: a film about life in the 19th century in the American West, especially the lives of cowboys

name: descendant
trans: n. 后裔，子孙；（由过去类似物发展来的）派生物；（机器等）后继型产品 adj. 下降的；祖传的

sentences.english: If you must use descendant selectors, prefer child selectors, which at least only require evaluation of one additional node, not all the intermediate nodes up to an ancestor.
sentences.chinese: 如果您必须使用后代选择器，尽量使用子代选择器，这最少只需评估一个额外的节点，而非中间直至祖先的所有节点。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is related to a person who lived a long time ago, or to a family, group of people etc that existed in the past

name: enclosure
trans: n. 附件；围墙；围场

sentences.english: the bear enclosure at the zoo
sentences.chinese: 动物园中的熊园

sentences.english: the enclosure of arable land for pasture
sentences.chinese: 将耕地圈起来用作牧场

detailed_translations.english: an area surrounded by a wall or fence, and used for a particular purpose

name: heritage
trans: n. 遗产；传统；继承物；继承权 n. (Heritage)人名；(英)赫里蒂奇

sentences.english: the importance of preserving the national heritage
sentences.chinese: 保护民族遗产的重要性

sentences.english: beautiful old buildings which are part of our heritage
sentences.chinese: 属于我们遗产一部分的漂亮古建筑

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗产；传统；继承物；继承权
detailed_translations.english: the traditional beliefs, values, customs etc of a family, country, or society

name: ruin
trans: n. 毁坏；毁灭，灭亡；崩溃；破产，一无所有，丢掉工作；破产的根源，祸根；废墟；残存部分 v. 破坏，糟蹋；毁灭，对……有灾难性的影响；使破败，成为废墟；（使）破产；（诗文）头朝下跌落；堕落 n. (Ruin) （法、俄、意、瑞典）吕安（人名）

sentences.english: an interesting old ruin
sentences.chinese: 一处有意思的古老废墟

sentences.english: the ruins of a bombed-out office block
sentences.chinese: 被炸毁的办公楼的废墟

sentences.english: Jefferson was ruined by the lawsuit.
sentences.chinese: 杰弗逊因为那场官司倾家荡产。

sentences.english: This illness has ruined my life.
sentences.chinese: 这个病毁掉了我的生活。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a building that is left after the rest has been destroyed
to make someone lose all their money

name: spiritual
trans: adj. 精神的，心灵的；宗教的；（人）高尚的 n. 圣歌（尤指美国南部黑人的）

sentences.english: Painting helps fill a spiritual need for beauty.
sentences.chinese: 绘画可以满足对美的精神需求。

sentences.english: spiritual values
sentences.chinese: 精神价值

detailed_translations.chinese: 精神的， 心灵的； 宗教的
detailed_translations.english: relating to your spirit rather than to your body or mind

name: compost
trans: n. 堆肥；混合物 vt. 堆肥；施堆肥

sentences.english: ...a small compost heap.
sentences.chinese: …一小堆肥堆。

detailed_translations.english: a mixture of decayed plants, leaves etc used to improve the quality of soil

name: contribution
trans: n. 贡献；捐献；投稿

sentences.english: All the money has been raised by voluntary contribution.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些钱都是靠自愿捐献筹集的。

detailed_translations.english: something that you give or do in order to help something be successful

name: environment
trans: n. 环境，外界

sentences.english: Some of these chemicals are very damaging to the environment.
sentences.chinese: 这些化学品中有些对环境非常有害。

sentences.english: legislation to protect the environment
sentences.chinese: 保护环境的法规

sentences.english: the effects of acid rain on the environment
sentences.chinese: 酸雨对环境的影响

sentences.english: the government minister for the environment
sentences.chinese: 负责环境事务的政府部长

detailed_translations.english: the air, water, and land on Earth, which is affected by man’s activities

name: mature

detailed_translations.english: a marked out area of ground on which a sport is played

detailed_translations.chinese: 销售；投掷，扔；使猛然倒下；表达；把…定于特定程度；定调；架设，搭，营
detailed_translations.english: to fall or be moved suddenly in a particular direction, or to make someone or something do this

name: vibrate
trans: vi. 振动；颤动；摇摆；踌躇 vt. 使振动；使颤动

sentences.english: The floor was vibrating to the beat of the music.
sentences.chinese: 地板随着音乐的节奏在颤动。

sentences.english: As air passes over our vocal cords, it makes them vibrate.
sentences.chinese: 气流通过我们的声带，使之产生振动。

detailed_translations.english: if something vibrates, or if you vibrate it, it shakes quickly and continuously with very small movements
if something vibrates, or if you vibrate it, it shakes quickly and continuously with very small movements

name: climate
trans: n. 气候；风气；思潮；风土

sentences.english: Los Angeles’ warm dry climate
sentences.chinese: 洛杉矶温暖干燥的气候

detailed_translations.chinese: 气候； 风土， 地带； 风气， 气氛
detailed_translations.english: the typical weather conditions in a particular area

name: conditions
trans: n. （生活或工作等的）条件；（影响某事发生的）物质环境；（天气、地面等的）情况 n. 疾病；条款；先决条件（condition 的复数） v. 制约；（使）接受；（使）达到所要求的状态；（使）酿熟；（啤酒等）继续发酵；保养（皮肤、头发）；（使）健康；提出条件；给学生打需补考的分数（condition 的第三人称单数形式）

name: germinate
trans: vt. 使发芽；使生长 vi. 发芽；生长

sentences.english: Some seed varieties germinate fast, so check every day or so.
sentences.chinese: 有一些品种的种子发芽快，所以差不多每天都要察看一下。

detailed_translations.english: if a seed germinates, or if it is germinated, it begins to grow

name: greenhouse
trans: n. 温室 造成温室效应的

sentences.english: What we are seeking, after all, is not simply an agreement to limit greenhouse gas emissions.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在寻求的目标毕竟不只是一项限制温室气体排放的协议。

sentences.english: I think each and every one of us is responsible for the greenhouse gases we emit in our daily actions and choices.
sentences.chinese: 我认为每一个人都是我们每天的行动和选择中排放的温室气体的责任。

sentences.english: But presently it was set in a greenhouse, where the sunlight fell warm upon it, and water was sprinkled over it, and day by day as it waited, a change began to come to it.
sentences.chinese: 但是过了不久，黏土又给人放进了一间温室，这里阳光和煦地照射着它，并且经常给它喷水，这样就在它一天天静静等候的时候，某种变化终于开始到来。

detailed_translations.english: a glass building used for growing plants that need warmth, light, and protection

name: humidity
trans: n. [气象] 湿度；湿气

sentences.english: The room is kept at 72 degrees and 50% relative humidity.
sentences.chinese: 房间的温度保持在72度，相对湿度50%。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of water contained in the air

name: wavelength
trans: n. [物] 波长

sentences.english: Sunlight consists of different wavelengths of radiation.
sentences.chinese: 阳光由波长不同的射线组成。

detailed_translations.english: the size of a radio wave used to broadcast a radio signal

name: astronomer
trans: n. 天文学家

sentences.english: My ideal is to be an astronomer.
sentences.chinese: 我的理想是当一个天文学家。

sentences.english: If people know you’re an astronomer, they will soon be asking you all about it.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人知道你是个天文学家，他们会很快向你询问关于这件事的一切。

sentences.english: Any astronomer, at any university, in any country can write a proposal for what they want to do with the telescope.
sentences.chinese: 任何国家、任何大学的天文学家都可以递交申请，告诉我们他们想要使用这台望远镜做什么。

detailed_translations.english: a scientist who studies the stars and  planet s

name: atmosphere
trans: n. 气氛；大气；空气

sentences.english: The hotel had a lovely relaxed atmosphere .
sentences.chinese: 那家宾馆的气氛轻松愉快。

sentences.english: The atmosphere at home was rather tense.
sentences.chinese: 家里的气氛很紧张。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that an event or place gives you

name: collision
trans: n. 碰撞；冲突；（意见，看法）的抵触；（政党等的）倾轧

sentences.english: Two people were killed in a head-on collision (= between two vehicles that are moving directly towards each other ) on highway 218.
sentences.chinese: 218号公路上有两辆汽车迎面相撞，两人死亡。

sentences.english: a collision between the two countries over fishing rights
sentences.chinese: 两国为捕鱼权而发生的冲突

detailed_translations.english: an accident in which two or more people or vehicles hit each other while moving in different directions

name: element
trans: n. 元素；要素；原理；成分；自然环境 n. (Element)人名；(德)埃勒门特；(英)埃利门特

sentences.english: Business and management elements are built into the course.
sentences.chinese: 本课程加入了商务和管理方面的内容。

sentences.english: Hydrogen is a one-valence element.
sentences.chinese: 氢是一价的元素。

detailed_translations.english: one part or feature of a whole system, plan, piece of work etc, especially one that is basic or important

name: orbit
trans: n. 轨道；眼眶；势力范围；生活常规 vi. 盘旋；绕轨道运行 vt. 绕…轨道而行

sentences.english: Mars and Earth have orbits which change with time.
sentences.chinese: 火星和地球的轨道随着时间而发生改变。

detailed_translations.english: the curved path travelled by an object which is moving around another much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc
to travel in a curved path around a much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc

name: ancestor
trans: n. 始祖，祖先；被继承人

sentences.english: My ancestors were French.
sentences.chinese: 我的祖先是法国人。

detailed_translations.english: a member of your family who lived a long time ago

name: caribou
trans: n. 北美驯鹿 n. (Caribou)人名；(法)卡里布

sentences.english: A herd of antelopes, asses, buffalos, caribou, deer, elephants, elk, giraffes, harts, horses, ibex, moose, seals, sheep, walruses, whales, zebras.
sentences.chinese: 一群羚羊，驴，野牛，驯鹿，鹿，大象，麋鹿，长颈鹿，雄鹿，马，野山羊，驼鹿，海豹，山羊，海象，鲸鱼，斑马。

sentences.english: In the Canadian Yukon, scientists are using genetic techniques to identify caribou and to study ancient caribou that roamed the same ice patches 6,000 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 在加拿大的育空地区，科学家们正在利用基因技术来鉴别北美驯鹿，并探究古时驯鹿的相关信息，6000年前它们曾在这块流冰区漫步。

detailed_translations.english: a North American  reindeer

name: igloo
trans: n. 圆顶建筑；雪块砌成的圆顶小屋；冰屋；爱斯基摩人圆顶小屋

sentences.english: Defining the town center of Râmnicu Vâlcea is a towering shopping mall that looks like a giant glass igloo.
sentences.chinese: 沃尔恰市中心的地标性建筑是一座高耸的购物商场，它看上去就像是一座巨型的玻璃圆顶建筑。

sentences.english: When you sign up, you adopt an animated penguin to chat to friends, play games, explore, collect coins and even personalise your very own igloo.
sentences.chinese: 当你注册后，你就会领养一直动画企鹅，与朋友聊天，玩游戏，探索，收集硬币，甚至个性化你自己的圆顶冰屋。

sentences.english: The next morning he and Egarter Vigl spruced up the body with a fine spray of sterilized water, which froze on contact. Then they slid the Iceman back into his high-tech igloo and closed the door.
sentences.chinese: 第二天早上，他和维格用一种很好的喷雾消毒水通过其冰冻接触清洁了冰人，之后将他滑进他的高科技圆顶建筑，关上门。

detailed_translations.english: Igloos are dome-shaped houses built from blocks of snow by the Inuit people

name: indigenous
trans: adj. 本土的；土著的；国产的；固有的

sentences.english: the many indigenous cultures which existed in Siberia
sentences.chinese: 存在于西伯利亚的许多当地文化

detailed_translations.chinese: 本土的；土著的；国产的；固有的
detailed_translations.english: indigenous people or things have always been in the place where they are, rather than being brought there from somewhere else

name: migrate
trans: vi. 移动；随季节而移居；移往 vt. 使移居；使移植

sentences.english: People migrate to cities like Jakarta in search of work.
sentences.chinese: 人们移居到雅加达这样的城市找工作。

sentences.english: Most birds have to fly long distances to migrate.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的鸟类不得不飞行很长的距离进行迁徙。

detailed_translations.english: if people migrate, they go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

name: tundra
trans: n. [生态] 苔原；[地理] 冻原；冻土地带

sentences.english: Frozen dog dirt stipples the tundra of the golf course.
sentences.chinese: 冻成冰块的狗屎点缀着高尔夫球场的苔原。

sentences.english: The park contains 150 lakes and 450 miles of streams, plus ecosystems ranging from wetlands to pine forests to montane areas to alpine tundra.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家公园包括150个湖泊和450英里河流以及从湿地到松林、从山丘到高山冻原等各种生态系统。

detailed_translations.english: the large flat areas of land in the north of Russia, Canada etc, where it is very cold and there are no trees

name: endure
trans: vt. 忍耐；容忍 vi. 忍耐；持续

sentences.english: It seemed impossible that anyone could endure such pain.
sentences.chinese: 似乎谁都不可能忍受这样的疼痛。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a difficult or painful situation for a long time without complaining

name: ethic
trans: n. 伦理；道德规范 adj. 伦理的；道德的（等于ethical）

sentences.english: The old ethic of hard work has given way to a new ethic of instant gratification.
sentences.chinese: 旧有的崇尚勤勉的道德观已被及时行乐的新观念所取代。

detailed_translations.english: a general idea or belief that influences people’s behaviour and attitudes

name: grueling
trans: adj. 使人精疲力尽的；艰辛的；让人受不了的

sentences.english: Yet he went on to win the Tour de France, one of the most grueling sports events there is, a record 7 times.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他却在环法自行车赛获胜，并破了连续7次夺冠的记录，要知道，这可是最折磨人的一项体育项目啊。

detailed_translations.english: Gruel is a food made by boiling oats with water or milk

name: stamina
trans: n. 耐力，持久力，毅力；雄蕊（stamen 的复数） n. (Stamina) （俄、加、美）史大弥娜（人名）

sentences.english: You need stamina to be a long-distance runner.
sentences.chinese: 当长跑运动员需要耐力。

sentences.english: Elaine has the stamina and the determination to succeed.
sentences.chinese: 伊莱恩具有成功所需的毅力和决心。

detailed_translations.english: physical or mental strength that lets you continue doing something for a long time without getting tired

name: terrain
trans: n. [地理] 地形，地势；领域；地带

sentences.english: rocky terrain
sentences.chinese: 多石的地形

detailed_translations.chinese: [地理] 地形，地势；领域；地带
detailed_translations.english: a particular type of land

name: helium
trans: n. [化学] 氦（符号为He，2号元素）

sentences.english: But it is far more than a bland ball of hydrogen and helium.
sentences.chinese: 但它绝不仅仅是一个由氢和氦组成的平淡星球。

sentences.english: Some cables will deliver helium to the balloons, others will carry the solar energy back to earth.
sentences.chinese: 其中的一些电缆将传送氦到气球里面，其余的将运载太阳能返回到地球。

sentences.english: Just as in the sun, the chain reaction in the second stage fuses the hydrogen atoms into heavier helium atoms and releases vast amounts of energy in the process.
sentences.chinese: 正如在太阳上所进行的反应一样，第二阶段连锁反应将氢原子聚合成较重的氦原子并在这一过程中释放出巨大的能量。

detailed_translations.english: a gas that is lighter than air and is used to make  balloons  float. It is a chemical  element  ：symbol He

name: hydrogen
trans: n. [化学] 氢

sentences.english: Water contains hydrogen and oxygen.
sentences.chinese: 水含有氢和氧。

sentences.english: Water can be reduced to oxygen and hydrogen by electrolysis.
sentences.chinese: 水通过电解可以分解为氧和氢。

sentences.english: The first bubbles to escape from the liquid are a mixture of air and hydrogen.
sentences.chinese: 从该液体中最先逸出的气泡是空气和氢的混合物。

detailed_translations.english: Hydrogen is a colourless gas that is the lightest and commonest element in the universe

name: solar system
trans: [天] 太阳系

sentences.english: Why do scientists think something could be hidden beyond the edge of our solar system?
sentences.chinese: 为什么科学家认为可能有某种东西潜藏在太阳系的边缘？

detailed_translations.english: the Sun and the  planets  that go around it

name: colony
trans: n. 殖民地；移民队；种群；动物栖息地

sentences.english: Algeria was formerly a French colony.
sentences.chinese: 阿尔及利亚以前是法国的殖民地。

detailed_translations.english: a country or area that is under the political control of a more powerful country, usually one that is far away

name: equator
trans: n. 赤道

sentences.english: The United States is north of the equator.
sentences.chinese: 美国位于赤道以北。

sentences.english: In the hot zone near the equator the sun heats the air continually; hence the air there ascends.
sentences.chinese: 在靠近赤道的热带地区，太阳不断地加热那里的空气，于是那里的热空气就上升。

detailed_translations.english: an imaginary line drawn around the middle of the Earth that is exactly the same distance from the North Pole and the South Pole

name: migration
trans: n. 迁移；移民；移动

sentences.english: What does this migration not do?
sentences.chinese: 这种迁移不能做什么？

sentences.english: Because of this and other differences in the two versions, we recommend that you test the maps after migration.
sentences.chinese: 由于这两个版本之间的种种差异，我们建议您在完成迁移后对映射进行测试。

detailed_translations.english: when large numbers of people go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

name: reserve
trans: v. 预订（座位等）；储备；拥有（某种权利）；留出（一部分稍后使用）；用于（特定场合）；暂不作（判断或决定）；把……专门留给；弥撒后保留部分圣餐 n. 储备（量）；自然保护区；居住地；预备队；预备役部队；缄默；保留意见；储备金；（拍卖中的）底价；（印染中的）防染本色区 n. (Reserve) （挪、美、法、俄、墨）勒塞尔夫（人名）

sentences.english: Do you have to reserve tickets in advance?
sentences.chinese: 你必须预先订票吗？

detailed_translations.english: to arrange for a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc to be kept for you to use at a particular time in the future

detailed_translations.chinese: 储备； 保留； 拘谨， 矜持； 替补队员， 后备部队； 自然保护区
detailed_translations.english: a supply of something kept to be used if it is needed

name: safari
trans: n. 狩猎远征，游猎；长途旅行；旅游期间；外出期间 n. (Safari) （美、伊朗、英）萨法里（人名）

sentences.english: He'd like to go on safari to photograph snakes and tigers.
sentences.chinese: 他想去游猎以拍摄蛇和老虎。

detailed_translations.english: a trip to see or hunt wild animals, especially in Africa

name: savanna
trans: n. [生态] 热带草原；热带的稀树大草原

name: cycle
trans: n. 循环；周期；自行车；整套；一段时间 vt. 使循环；使轮转 vi. 循环；骑自行车；轮转

sentences.english: a woman’s menstrual cycle
sentences.chinese: 女性的月经周期

detailed_translations.chinese: 自行车、 摩托车； 循环
detailed_translations.english: a number of related events that happen again and again in the same order

name: development
trans: n. 发展；开发；发育；住宅小区（专指由同一开发商开发的）；[摄] 显影

sentences.english: child development
sentences.chinese: 儿童发育

sentences.english: The funds will be used for marketing and product development.
sentences.chinese: 这笔资金将用于市场营销和产品开发。

detailed_translations.english: the process of gradually becoming bigger, better, stronger, or more advanced

name: fertilize
trans: vt. 使受精；使肥沃

sentences.english: The faeces contain nitrogen which fertilizes the soil.
sentences.chinese: 排泄物含有肥沃土壤的氮。

detailed_translations.english: To fertilize land means to improve its quality in order to make plants grow well on it, by spreading solid animal waste or a chemical mixture on it

name: metamorphosis
trans: n. 变形；变质

name: bistro
trans: n. 小酒馆 n. (Bistro)人名；(法)比斯特罗

sentences.english: a French bistro
sentences.chinese: 一间法式小餐馆

detailed_translations.english: a small restaurant or bar

name: covet
trans: vt. 垂涎；觊觎 vi. 垂涎；觊觎

sentences.english: The Michelin Awards are coveted by restaurants all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 米其林评级是全世界所有餐厅的渴望。

detailed_translations.english: to have a very strong desire to have something that someone else has

name: culinary
trans: adj. 烹饪的，烹饪用的；食物的

sentences.english: culinary skills
sentences.chinese: 烹饪技术

sentences.english: mushrooms dried for culinary use
sentences.chinese: 弄干作烹饪用的蘑菇

sentences.english: the region’s culinary delights
sentences.chinese: 这个地区的美味佳肴

detailed_translations.english: relating to cooking

name: reservation
trans: n. 预约，预订；保留

sentences.english: a dinner reservation
sentences.chinese: 预订晚餐

sentences.english: Customers are advised to make seat reservations well in advance.
sentences.chinese: 建议顾客提前订座。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement which you make so that a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc is kept for you at a particular time in the future

name: signature
trans: n. 署名；签名；信号

sentences.english: Her signature is totally illegible (= cannot be read ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的签字完全无法辨认。

sentences.english: The school collected 4,000 signatures for the petition.
sentences.chinese: 学校为这份请愿书收集到了四千个签名。

sentences.english: The Ukrainians put their signatures to the Lisbon Protocol.
sentences.chinese: 乌克兰签署了《里斯本协议》。

sentences.english: Someone’s forged my signature (= made an illegal copy of my name to deceive people ) on this letter.
sentences.chinese: 有人在这封信中伪造了我的签名。

sentences.english: Each child must obtain the signature of his or her parents.
sentences.chinese: 每个小孩都必须得到父母的签字。

detailed_translations.english: your name written in the way you usually write it, for example at the end of a letter, or on a cheque etc, to show that you have written it

name: ballet
trans: n. 芭蕾舞，芭蕾舞曲，芭蕾舞剧；芭蕾舞团；芭蕾式交流 n. (Ballet) （法、美）巴莱（人名）

sentences.english: She wants to be a ballet dancer .
sentences.chinese: 她想当芭蕾舞演员。

sentences.english: We’re going to the ballet tomorrow evening.
sentences.chinese: 我们明天晚上要去看芭蕾舞演出。

detailed_translations.english: a style of dancing that tells a dramatic story with music but no talking or singing

name: choreographer
trans: n. 编舞者，舞蹈指导

sentences.english: My choreographer keeps chiseling away at me, hoping to shape me into perfection.
sentences.chinese: 我的舞蹈编导总是不断雕琢我，一心将我塑造成完美的舞蹈家。

sentences.english: "A choreographer told me that what professionals are looking for in a good dancer is core body strength, " said Dr Neave.
sentences.chinese: “一个舞蹈编导告诉我专家们寻找优秀舞蹈演员的核心指标就是身体力量，”内尔博士透露。

sentences.english: The old master even invited him over to his house, where Jackson taught the moonwalk to him and his choreographer Hermes Pan.
sentences.chinese: 这位老前辈甚至邀请他到家里来，在这儿杰克逊为阿斯泰尔和他的舞蹈教练展示了太空步。

detailed_translations.english: A choreographer is someone who invents the movements for a ballet or other dance and tells the dancers how to perform them

name: inspiration
trans: n. 灵感；鼓舞；吸气；妙计

sentences.english: The Malvern Hills have provided inspiration for many artists and musicians over the decades.
sentences.chinese: 几十年来，莫尔文丘陵为很多艺术家和音乐家提供了灵感。

sentences.english: He raised his eyes to the altar as if seeking inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 他抬头看看祭坛，似乎在寻求灵感。

sentences.english: He draws inspiration from ordinary scenes.
sentences.chinese: 他从日常生活中得到灵感。

sentences.english: Mary Quant’s inspiration comes from the glam style of the seventies.
sentences.chinese: 玛莉·官的灵感来自70年代的魅惑风格。

sentences.english: He had a sudden flash of inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 他突然灵感闪现。

sentences.english: He has always been a source of inspiration for me.
sentences.chinese: 他一直是我灵感的源泉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 灵感； 鼓舞人心的人
detailed_translations.english: a good idea about what you should do, write, say etc, especially one which you get suddenly

name: trailblazer
trans: n. 开拓者；开路的人；先驱者

name: antibiotic
trans: adj. 抗生的；抗菌的 n. 抗生素，抗菌素

sentences.english: "If you can stop the enzymes involved in that process with a small molecule or chemical," says Dunman, "that chemical could be an antibiotic.
sentences.chinese: “如果能用一小分子或化学物质阻止这一酶的活性过程，”德明说，“这种化学物质就能够用来做抗生素。”

sentences.english: If we all recognize that antibiotic resistance is one of the greatest threats to public health that we face today, we have to do something about this.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们大家都能认识到耐抗生素（药性）已经成为我们今天面对的最大的公众健康威胁之一，我们就真的需要做点什么了。

detailed_translations.english: a drug that is used to kill  bacteria  and cure infections

name: infection
trans: n. 感染；传染；影响；传染病

sentences.english: The baby had an ear infection.
sentences.chinese: 宝宝耳朵感染了。

detailed_translations.english: a disease that affects a particular part of your body and is caused by bacteria or a virus

name: mutate
trans: vi. 变化，产生突变 vt. 改变，使突变

sentences.english: Simple organisms like bacteria mutate rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 像细菌那样的简单有机体突变的速度很快。

detailed_translations.english: if an animal or plant mutates, it becomes different from others of the same kind, because of a change in its  genetic  structure

name: organism
trans: n. 有机体；生物体；微生物

sentences.english: All living organisms have to adapt to changes in environmental conditions.
sentences.chinese: 一切生物都要适应环境条件的变化。

sentences.english: Genes operate together in determining the characteristics of an individual organism.
sentences.chinese: 基因的共同作用决定生物个体的特性。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, plant, human, or any other living thing

name: cactus
trans: n. [园艺] 仙人掌

sentences.english: The giant cactus is the vegetable skycraper.
sentences.chinese: 高大的仙人掌是植物界巨人。

sentences.english: A saguaro cactus stands tall amid a frenzy of lightning bolts in Arizona.
sentences.chinese: 亚利桑那州，一株巨人柱仙人掌矗立在一团狂暴的闪电中。

sentences.english: The cactus… well, that will have to languish in the bathroom until next Spring.
sentences.chinese: 仙人掌……，在春天到来前都应该把它放在浴室里。

detailed_translations.english: a desert plant with sharp points instead of leaves

name: decompose
trans: vt. 分解；使腐烂 vi. 分解；腐烂

sentences.english: a partially decomposed body
sentences.chinese: 部分腐烂的尸体

detailed_translations.english: to decay or make something decay

name: hospitable
trans: adj. 热情友好的；（环境）舒适的

sentences.english: The local people were very kind and hospitable.
sentences.chinese: 当地人非常友好热情。

detailed_translations.english: friendly, welcoming, and generous to visitors

name: pollinate
trans: vt. 对...授粉

sentences.english: flowers pollinated by bees
sentences.chinese: 由蜜蜂授粉的花

detailed_translations.english: to give a flower or plant pollen so that it can produce seeds

name: transpire
trans: vi. 发生；蒸发；泄露 vt. 使蒸发；使排出

sentences.english: It now transpires that he kept all the money for himself.
sentences.chinese: 事实已经清楚，他把所有的钱都据为己有了。

detailed_translations.english: if it transpires that something is true, you discover that it is true

name: conservation
trans: n. 保存，保持；保护

sentences.english: wildlife conservation
sentences.chinese: 野生生物保护

sentences.english: a local conservation group
sentences.chinese: 当地的一个环境保护团体

detailed_translations.english: the protection of natural things such as animals, plants, forests etc, to prevent them from being spoiled or destroyed

name: contaminate
trans: vt. 污染，弄脏

sentences.english: Drinking water supplies are believed to have been contaminated.
sentences.chinese: 据信饮用水已受到污染。

detailed_translations.english: to make a place or substance dirty or harmful by putting something such as chemicals or poison in it

name: deforestation
trans: n. 毁林，采伐森林，森林开伐，烧林

sentences.english: the deforestation of the tropics
sentences.chinese: 热带森林的毁坏

detailed_translations.english: the cutting or burning down of all the trees in an area

name: mine
trans: n. 矿，矿藏；矿山，矿井；地雷，水雷 vt. 开采，采掘；在…布雷 vi. 开矿，采矿；埋设地雷 pron. 我的 n. (Mine)人名；(德、塞、土、毛里塔)米内

sentences.english: It was Glen’s idea, not mine.
sentences.chinese: 这是格伦的主意，不是我的。

sentences.english: ‘Is that your car?’ ‘No, mine is parked over the road.’
sentences.chinese: “那是你的车吗？”“不是，我的车停在路对面。”

sentences.english: You’ve got good legs – mine are too thin.
sentences.chinese: 你的腿很美——我的腿太细了。

sentences.english: His English is better than mine.
sentences.chinese: 他英语比我好。

detailed_translations.english: used by the person speaking or writing to refer to something that belongs to or is connected with himself or herself

name: prospecting
trans: n. 探矿

name: rainforest
trans: n. （热带）雨林

sentences.english: The rainforest is essential in other areas also.
sentences.chinese: 雨林在其他地区也是必不可少的。

sentences.english: The rainforest around our house sometimes brings forth intriguing creatures like this.
sentences.chinese: 我们的房子周围的雨林有时带来了这样有趣的生物。

sentences.english: Then we carried on in the worst conditions yet: low, tangled rainforest that blocked out the light, and mud up to our thighs.
sentences.chinese: 那时我们还在最糟糕的环境里行进着：低矮、纷乱的雨林遮住了阳光，泥浆没至我们的大腿。

name: barren
trans: adj. 贫瘠的；不生育的；无益的；沉闷无趣的；空洞的 n. 荒地 n. (Barren)人名；(西、英)巴伦

sentences.english: Thousands of years ago the surface was barren desert.
sentences.chinese: 很久很久以前，地面还是一片荒漠。

sentences.english: He prayed that his barren wife would one day have a child.
sentences.chinese: 他祈祷自己不孕的妻子有朝一日能怀上宝宝。

detailed_translations.english: (of land or soil) not good enough for plants to grow on it

name: café
trans: n. 咖啡馆；小餐馆

sentences.english: ...an Italian street café.
sentences.chinese: …一家意大利街边小餐馆。

detailed_translations.english: a small restaurant where you can buy drinks and simple meals

name: oasis
trans: n. 绿洲；舒适的地方；令人宽慰的事物 n. (Oasis)人名；(英)奥西斯

sentences.english: The immaculately tended gardens are an oasis in the midst of Cairo's urban sprawl.
sentences.chinese: 那些打理得非常整洁的花园是杂乱扩张的开罗市区中的一片绿洲。

detailed_translations.english: a place with water and trees in a desert

name: prime minister
trans: 首相，总理

sentences.english: ...the former prime minister of Pakistan, Miss Benazir Bhutto.
sentences.chinese: …巴基斯坦前总理贝娜齐尔·布托小姐。

detailed_translations.english: The leader of the government in some countries

name: casual
trans: adj. 随便的；非正式的；临时的；偶然的 n. 便装；临时工人；待命士兵

sentences.english: a casual manner
sentences.chinese: 漫不经心的态度

sentences.english: His eyes were angry, though he sounded casual.
sentences.chinese: 虽然他的语气满不在乎，但他的眼神充满怒气。

sentences.english: Marsha was quite casual about appearing on TV.
sentences.chinese: 玛莎对于上电视很无所谓。

sentences.english: a casual conversation
sentences.chinese: 随便的谈话

sentences.english: He made some casual remark (= one without thinking much about it ) about her holiday.
sentences.chinese: 他随口提到了她度假的事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 漫不经心的，随便的；偶然的
detailed_translations.english: relaxed and not worried, or seeming not to care about something

name: escapade
trans: n. 越轨行为；恶作剧

name: tolerate
trans: vt. 忍受；默许；宽恕

sentences.english: We simply will not tolerate vigilante groups on our streets.
sentences.chinese: 我们决不容许有自行惩办犯罪的组织出现在我们的街头。

sentences.english: This sort of behaviour will not be tolerated.
sentences.chinese: 这种行为是不能容许的。

detailed_translations.english: to allow people to do, say, or believe something without criticizing or punishing them

name: debate
trans: n. 辩论；（正式的）讨论 v. （尤指正式）讨论，辩论；仔细考虑

sentences.english: the gun-control debate in the US
sentences.chinese: 美国有关控制枪支的争论

sentences.english: The new drug has become the subject of heated debate within the medical profession.
sentences.chinese: 这种新药成了医学界激烈争论的话题。

sentences.english: There was much lively debate about whether women should spend more time in the home.
sentences.chinese: 就妇女是否应该花更多时间待在家里这个话题有许多热烈的争论。

sentences.english: A fierce debate raged over which artist’s work should be chosen for the prize.
sentences.chinese: 就哪位艺术家的作品应该得奖一事展开了激烈的争论。

sentences.english: The issue will be debated on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题将在星期二讨论。

detailed_translations.english: discussion of a particular subject that often continues for a long time and in which people express different opinions
to discuss a subject formally when you are trying to make a decision or find a solution

name: disclosure
trans: n. [审计] 披露；揭发；被揭发出来的事情

sentences.english: the disclosure of private medical information
sentences.chinese: 私人医疗信息的泄露

detailed_translations.chinese: [审计] 披露；揭发；被揭发出来的事情

name: editorial
trans: adj. 编辑的，主编的；社论的 n. （报刊）社论，（美国电台）评论

sentences.english: an editorial assistant
sentences.chinese: 编辑助理

detailed_translations.english: relating to the preparation of a newspaper, book, television programme etc for printing or broadcasting
a piece of writing in a newspaper that gives the editor’s opinion about something, rather than reporting facts

name: found
trans: vt. 创立，建立；创办 v. 找到（find的过去分词）

sentences.english: Founded in 1935 in Ohio, Alcoholics Anonymous is now a world-wide organization.
sentences.chinese: 嗜酒者互诫协会1935年创立于俄亥俄州，现在是一个世界性的组织。

sentences.english: Eton College was founded by Henry VI in 1440.
sentences.chinese: 伊顿公学于1440年由亨利六世创办。

detailed_translations.english: to start something such as an organization, company, school, or city, often by providing the necessary money

name: objective
trans: n. 目的；目标；（军事行动的）攻击目标；物镜；宾格 adj. 客观的；客观存在的；（疾病症状）客观的，他觉的；目标的；宾格的

sentences.english: He vowed to achieve certain objectives before the end of his presidency.
sentences.chinese: 他立誓要在他的总统任期结束之前实现某些目标。

sentences.english: the best way to accomplish your objectives
sentences.chinese: 完成目标的最佳方法

sentences.english: The degree program has two main objectives.
sentences.chinese: 该学位课程有两个主要目标。

sentences.english: Managers should set specific performance objectives for their teams.
sentences.chinese: 经理应该为自己的团队制定明确的绩效目标。

sentences.english: The main objective was to improve children’s knowledge of geography.
sentences.chinese: 主要目的是要增长儿童的地理知识。

sentences.english: A clear objective was set and adhered to.
sentences.chinese: 定下了明确的目标并坚持到底。

sentences.english: One of your first business objectives should be to get your own office.
sentences.chinese: 你的首要工作目标之一应该是拥有自己的办公室。

detailed_translations.english: something that you are trying hard to achieve, especially in business or politics

name: retire
trans: vi. 退休；撤退；退却 vt. 退休；离开；收回 n. 退休；退隐；退兵信号

sentences.english: At the age when most people retire, he is ready to face a new career.
sentences.chinese: 在大多数人退休的年纪，他准备要面对一项新事业。

sentences.english: I retired late that evening.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上我睡得晚。

detailed_translations.english: to stop working, usually because you have reached a certain age

name: article
trans: n. 文章；物品；条款；[语] 冠词 vt. 订约将…收为学徒或见习生；使…受协议条款的约束 vi. 签订协议；进行控告

sentences.english: The paper’s leading article (=  the main article  ) described the government as weak.
sentences.chinese: 该报社论称政府软弱。

sentences.english: newspaper articles
sentences.chinese: 报纸上的文章

sentences.english: household articles
sentences.chinese: 家居用品

sentences.english: Article 1 of the constitution guarantees freedom of religion.
sentences.chinese: 宪法的第一条保障宗教信仰自由。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of writing about a particular subject in a newspaper or magazine

name: copy
trans: n. 副本；一册；稿件；作业本；（报纸、杂志的）题材；广告文字 vt. 复制；抄写；抄送；抄袭；效仿；收到，听见 vi. 复制；抄写

sentences.english: back-up copies of your files
sentences.chinese: 你的文档的备份

sentences.english: Could you copy this letter and send it out, please?
sentences.chinese: 你能把这封信复印一份发出去吗？

detailed_translations.english: something that is made to be exactly like another thing
to deliberately make or produce something that is exactly like another thing

name: editor
trans: n. 编者，编辑；社论撰写人；编辑装置

sentences.english: the editor of the Daily Telegraph
sentences.chinese: 《每日电讯报》的主编

detailed_translations.english: the person who is in charge of a newspaper or magazine, or part of a newspaper or magazine, and decides what should be included in it

name: factual
trans: adj. 事实的；真实的

sentences.english: Try to keep your account of events as factual as possible.
sentences.chinese: 你要尽量如实地说明情况。

detailed_translations.english: based on facts or relating to facts

name: libel
trans: n. 诽谤罪；诋毁；毁坏名誉的东西；控诉书 vt. 中伤；控告；对…进行诽谤 vi. 进行文字诽谤

sentences.english: restrictions on press freedom, such as libel laws
sentences.chinese: 诽谤法之类对新闻自由的限制

detailed_translations.chinese: 诽谤罪；诋毁；毁坏名誉的东西；控诉书
detailed_translations.english: when someone writes or prints untrue statements about someone so that other people could have a bad opinion of them
to write or print a libel against someone

name: reporter
trans: n. 记者

sentences.english: a news reporter
sentences.chinese: 新闻记者

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to write about news events for a newspaper, or to tell people about them on television or on the radio

name: anxiety
trans: n. 焦虑；渴望；挂念；令人焦虑的事

sentences.english: his feelings of anxiety
sentences.chinese: 他焦虑的心情

sentences.english: A high level of anxiety was created by the introduction of cameras into the factory.
sentences.chinese: 工厂安装了摄像头，这引起了工人的高度不安。

sentences.english: It can help if you discuss your anxieties with someone.
sentences.chinese: 与别人谈谈自己的忧虑会有帮助的。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being very worried about something

name: cope
trans: vi. 处理；对付；竞争 n. 长袍 n. (Cope)人名；(英)科普；(西)科佩

sentences.english: Sometimes I find it hard to cope.
sentences.chinese: 有时候我觉得很难应付。

sentences.english: He coped quite well as manager while still captaining the team.
sentences.chinese: 他是球队的主教练，同时兼任队长，干得相当好。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in dealing with a difficult problem or situation

name: courage
trans: n. 勇气；胆量 n. (Courage)人名；(英)卡里奇；(法)库拉热

sentences.english: Sue showed great courage throughout her illness.
sentences.chinese: 休在生病期间表现出了极大的勇气。

sentences.english: Driving again after his accident must have taken a lot of courage (= needed courage ) .
sentences.chinese: 他出事故后再驾车肯定需要很大的勇气。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being brave when you are facing a difficult or dangerous situation or when you are very ill

name: irritation
trans: n. 刺激；激怒，恼怒，生气；兴奋；令人恼火的事

sentences.english: The heavy traffic is a constant source of irritation.
sentences.chinese: 拥挤的交通一向是令人头痛的问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 刺激；激怒，恼怒，生气；兴奋；令人恼火的事
detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being annoyed about something, especially something that happens repeatedly or for a long time

name: relationship
trans: n. 关系；关联

sentences.english: I have quite a good relationship with my parents.
sentences.chinese: 我和父母关系很好。

sentences.english: the relationship between diet and health problems
sentences.chinese: 膳食与健康问题之间的联系

detailed_translations.english: the way in which two people or two groups feel about each other and behave towards each other

name: wisdom
trans: n. 智慧，才智；明智；学识；至理名言 n. (Wisdom)人名；(英)威兹德姆

sentences.english: a man of great wisdom
sentences.chinese: 一个有大智慧的男人

sentences.english: You can always expect a few words of wisdom from Dave.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫总能冒出几句至理名言。

detailed_translations.english: good sense and judgment, based especially on your experience of life

name: complex
trans: adj. 复杂的；合成的 n. 复合体；综合设施

sentences.english: a complex system of highways
sentences.chinese: 复杂的公路网

sentences.english: Photosynthesis is a highly complex process.
sentences.chinese: 光合作用是一个非常复杂的过程。

sentences.english: Peter seemed to have an instant understanding of the most complex issues.
sentences.chinese: 再复杂的问题彼得似乎也是一看就明白。

sentences.english: It was a very complex relationship between two complex people.
sentences.chinese: 这是两个复杂的人之间非常复杂的关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由许多部分组成的，复合的；复杂的，难懂的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of many different parts and often difficult to understand

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合体， 集合体； 情结， 夸大的情绪反应
detailed_translations.english: a group of buildings, or a large building with many parts, used for a particular purpose

name: doubt
trans: n. 怀疑；疑问；疑惑 v. 怀疑；不信；恐怕；拿不准

sentences.english: There was still one little nagging doubt at the back of his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他的心头仍有一丝挥之不去的疑虑。

sentences.english: Kim never doubted his story.
sentences.chinese: 例句：金对于他讲的事情从不怀疑。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being not sure whether something is true or right
to think that something may not be true or that it is unlikely

name: interesting
trans: adj. 有趣的；引起兴趣的，令人关注的

sentences.english: That’s an interesting question.
sentences.chinese: 那是一个有趣的问题。

sentences.english: a really interesting TV programme
sentences.chinese: 十分有趣的电视节目

sentences.english: Did you meet any interesting people?
sentences.chinese: 你见过什么有意思的人吗？

sentences.english: It’s interesting that no one remembers seeing the car.
sentences.chinese: 竟然没人记得见过这辆车，真是有趣。

detailed_translations.english: attracting your attention because it is special, exciting or unusual

name: researching
trans: 研究 研究员

name: similarity
trans: n. 类似；相似点

sentences.english: They are both blonde, but there the similarity ends .
sentences.chinese: 他们俩都是金发，但相同之处也就仅此而已。

detailed_translations.english: if there is a similarity between two things or people, they are similar in some way

name: system
trans: n. 制度，体制；系统；方法

sentences.english: an alarm system
sentences.chinese: 警报系统

sentences.english: a well-designed heating system
sentences.chinese: 设计良好的供暖系统

sentences.english: the digestive system
sentences.chinese: 消化系统

sentences.english: the railway system
sentences.chinese: 铁路系统

detailed_translations.chinese: 系统； 制度， 体制； 方法， 做法； 身体
detailed_translations.english: a group of related parts that work together as a whole for a particular purpose

name: hibernate
trans: vi. 过冬；（动物）冬眠；（人等）避寒

sentences.english: Dormice hibernate from October to May.
sentences.chinese: 睡鼠从10月到5月冬眠。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过冬；（动物）冬眠；（人等）避寒
detailed_translations.english: if an animal hibernates, it sleeps for the whole winter

name: inhospitable
trans: adj. 不适宜居住的（由于天气恶劣或缺乏遮蔽处），条件恶劣的；不好客的，冷淡的

sentences.english: an inhospitable climate
sentences.chinese: 不宜人的气候

sentences.english: He trekked across some of the most inhospitable terrain in the world.
sentences.chinese: 他长途跋涉，穿越了世界上一些最荒凉的地带。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不好客的,不适于居住的
detailed_translations.english: an inhospitable place is difficult to live or stay in because the weather conditions are unpleasant or there is no shelter

name: permafrost
trans: n. 多年冻土；永久冻结带；永久冰冻

sentences.english: Yakutsk is the largest city in the world built on permafrost – soil that remains permanently frozen year round.
sentences.chinese: 雅库茨克是世界上建设在永久冻土上最大的城市——土壤在全年都保持冰冻。

detailed_translations.english: a layer of soil that is always frozen in countries where it is very cold

name: budget
trans: n. 预算，预算费 vt. 安排，预定；把…编入预算 vi. 编预算，做预算 adj. 廉价的

sentences.english: We’ll have to budget more carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须更仔细地安排开支。

sentences.english: This scheme enables you to budget the cost through fixed monthly payments.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划可以让你把费用分摊在每个月里等额偿还。

sentences.english: Cheap flights are available from budget travel agents from $240.
sentences.chinese: 起价$240的廉价机票可从一些经济旅行社那里买到。

detailed_translations.english: to carefully plan and control how much money you spend and what you will buy with it

detailed_translations.chinese: 低廉的， 收费公道的
detailed_translations.english: Budget is used in advertising to suggest that something is being sold cheaply
the money that is available to an organization or person, or a plan of how it will be spent

name: funding
trans: n. 提供资金；用发行长期债券的方法来收回短期债券 v. 提供资金；积存（fund的ing形式）

sentences.english: They hope for government funding for the programme.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望得到政府为这一计划提供的资金。

detailed_translations.chinese: 基金， 资金； 提供资金
detailed_translations.english: Funding is money which a government or organization provides for a particular purpose

name: petition
trans: n. 请愿；请愿书；祈求；[法] 诉状 vi. 请愿；请求 vt. 请愿；请求；恳求

sentences.english: Local residents have drawn up a petition to protest the hospital closure.
sentences.chinese: 当地居民已草拟了一份请愿书，抗议关闭医院。

sentences.english: Villagers petitioned the local authority to provide better bus services.
sentences.chinese: 村民请愿要求地方当局提供更好的公共汽车服务。

detailed_translations.english: a written request signed by a lot of people, asking someone in authority to do something or change something
to ask the government or an organization to do something by sending them a petition

name: coop
trans: v. 把……关进笼子里；拘禁 n. （关鸡等的）笼子；捕鱼篓

sentences.english: ...a chicken coop.

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…关进笼子里；限制；拘禁
detailed_translations.english: to confine in a restricted area

detailed_translations.chinese: 值勤警察在警车里打瞌睡

detailed_translations.english: a building for small animals, especially chickens

name: graze
trans: vt. 放牧；擦伤 vi. 吃草；擦伤 n. 放牧；轻擦

sentences.english: fields where they used to graze their sheep
sentences.chinese: 他们过去放羊的田野

detailed_translations.english: if an animal grazes, or if you graze it, it eats grass that is growing
to accidentally break the surface of your skin by rubbing it against something
a wound caused by rubbing that slightly breaks the surface of your skin

name: groom
trans: v. （给动物）刷洗； （给自己或其他动物）梳毛；（使）整洁；照料（草坪、滑雪坡等）；（使）做好准备；诱骗（儿童以图对其实施性侵犯） n. 马夫；新郎；王室侍从官 n. (Groom) （美）格鲁姆（人名）

sentences.english: The horses were exercised and groomed with special care.
sentences.chinese: 这些马受到特殊的训练和照料。

detailed_translations.chinese: 整饰；推荐；喂马；刷洗（马等）
detailed_translations.english: to clean and brush an animal, especially a horse
a  bridegroom

name: pasture
trans: n. 草地；牧场；牧草 vt. 放牧；吃草 n. (Pasture)人名；(英)帕斯彻；(法)帕斯蒂尔

sentences.english: large areas of rough upland pasture
sentences.chinese: 大片起伏的山地牧场

sentences.english: the lush pastures of the southern counties
sentences.chinese: 南部各郡茂盛的牧场

detailed_translations.english: land or a field that is covered with grass and is used for cattle, sheep etc to feed on
to put animals outside in a field to feed on the grass

name: trough
trans: n. 水槽；饲料槽；低谷期；低气压；波谷

sentences.english: a horse trough
sentences.chinese: 马槽

detailed_translations.chinese: 水槽，水槽；低谷期；饲料槽；低气压
detailed_translations.english: a long narrow open container that holds water or food for animals

name: hieroglyph
trans: n. 象形文字；图画文字；秘密符号

sentences.english: Initially the patterns I used were hieroglyph like symbols.
sentences.chinese: 我所采用的图案是类似符号的象形文字。

sentences.english: In the Late Period, the hieroglyph of the bird was used to represent this deity directly.
sentences.chinese: 在后来的时期内，鸟的象形文字直接用来表现神。

sentences.english: Initially the patterns I used were hieroglyph like symbols. After a holiday in the Maldives the "face" patterns developed. The local fishes gave me endless inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 我所采用的图案是类似符号的象形文字。在马尔代夫度假后，这些“脸”的图形开始发展。那里的鱼类给了我无穷无尽的灵感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 象形文字, 图画文字
detailed_translations.english: a picture or symbol used to represent a word or part of a word, especially in the ancient Egyptian writing system

name: logogram
trans: n. 简写；速记用略字；标记

name: phonogram
trans: n. 音标符号；录音片；语音图；形声字

name: pictographic
trans: adj. 象形文字的，绘画文字的

name: scribe
trans: n. 抄写员；作家；划线器 vt. 写下，记下；用划线器划 vi. 写下，记下；担任抄写员 n. (Scribe)人名；(法)斯克里布

sentences.english: Might I your scribe and your confessor be.
sentences.chinese: 我可以你和你的忏悔神父是抄写员。

sentences.english: I stepped out of his office and was brought to a small window near the exit, behind which sat a scribe who I knew must be a prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 我走出他的办公室，被带到监狱出口处的一个小窗户边。窗后坐着一个抄写员，我知道他肯定是个囚徒。

detailed_translations.english: someone in the past whose job was to make written copies of official documents

name: agent
trans: n. 代理人，代理商；药剂；特工；动因 vt. 由…作中介；由…代理 adj. 代理的 n. (Agent)人名；(罗)阿真特

sentences.english: Our agent in Rio deals with all our Brazilian business.
sentences.chinese: 我们在里约热内卢的业务代表处理我们在巴西的全部业务。

detailed_translations.english: a person or company that represents another person or company, especially in business

name: assassinate
trans: vt. 暗杀；行刺

sentences.english: a plot to assassinate the President
sentences.chinese: 刺杀总统的阴谋

detailed_translations.english: to murder an important person

name: democracy
trans: n. 民主，民主主义；民主政治

sentences.english: a return to democracy after 16 years of military rule
sentences.chinese: 16年军人统治后民主制度的恢复

detailed_translations.english: a system of government in which every citizen in the country can vote to elect its government officials

name: investigate
trans: v. 调查；研究

sentences.english: The state police are investigating the incident.
sentences.chinese: 州警察正调查此事。

sentences.english: The study investigates the impact of violent TV programming on children.
sentences.chinese: 该研究调查暴力电视节目对儿童的影响。

sentences.english: I heard a noise and went downstairs to investigate.
sentences.chinese: 我听见响声，就下楼去看个究竟。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find out the truth about something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

name: oath
trans: n. 誓言，誓约；诅咒，咒骂

sentences.english: The president took the oath of office (= made the official public promises that every president makes when starting their job ) .
sentences.chinese: 总统宣誓就职。

sentences.english: She could not break her oath .
sentences.chinese: 她不能违背誓言。

detailed_translations.english: a formal and very serious promise

name: threat
trans: n. 威胁，恐吓；凶兆

sentences.english: Your threats don’t scare me.
sentences.chinese: 你的那些威胁吓不倒我。

sentences.english: threats made against his wife and children
sentences.chinese: 对他妻儿的威胁

sentences.english: Nichols never carried out his threat to resign.
sentences.chinese: 尼科尔斯威胁过要辞职，但从未付诸行动。

sentences.english: The government will not give in to terrorist threats .
sentences.chinese: 政府不会屈服于恐怖分子的威胁。

sentences.english: She dismissed the statement as an empty threat .
sentences.chinese: 她无视这项声明，认为是个空口威胁。

sentences.english: They warned him with veiled threats not to mention anything he had witnessed.
sentences.chinese: 他们话中有话地威胁他不要提及他所目睹的事。

sentences.english: The police are investigating death threats made against the two men.
sentences.chinese: 警方正在调查针对这两名男子的死亡恐吓。

sentences.english: Officials at the school say they received a bomb threat at approximately 11:30 a.m. today.
sentences.chinese: 学校的官员说他们在今天上午11点半左右收到过炸弹恐吓。

detailed_translations.english: a statement in which you tell someone that you will cause them harm or trouble if they do not do what you want

name: amiable
trans: adj. 和蔼可亲的，亲切的 n. (Amiable)人名；(法)阿米亚布勒；(英)阿米娅布尔

sentences.english: The driver was an amiable young man.
sentences.chinese: 司机是位友善的年轻人。

sentences.english: She was in an amiable mood.
sentences.chinese: 她心情很好。

detailed_translations.english: friendly and easy to like

detailed_translations.chinese: (Amiable)人名；(法)阿米亚布勒；(英)阿米娅布尔

name: condemn
trans: vt. 谴责；判刑，定罪；声讨

sentences.english: Politicians were quick to condemn the bombing.
sentences.chinese: 政治家们立即对爆炸事件进行了谴责。

sentences.english: He was found guilty and condemned to death.
sentences.chinese: 他被裁定有罪，判了死刑。

detailed_translations.english: to say very strongly that you do not approve of something or someone, especially because you think it is morally wrong

name: oblige
trans: vt. 迫使；强制；赐，施恩惠；责成；义务 vi. 帮忙；施恩惠

sentences.english: Mr. Oakley has always been ready to oblige journalists with information.
sentences.chinese: 奥克利先生一直乐于提供信息帮助记者们。

sentences.english: We called up three economists to ask how to eliminate the deficit and they obliged with very straightforward answers.
sentences.chinese: 我们致电3位经济学家咨询消除赤字的方法，他们满足了我们的要求，给出了非常直接的答复。

detailed_translations.english: To oblige someone means to be helpful to them by doing what they have asked you to do

detailed_translations.chinese: 迫使；施恩于，帮…的忙；使感激
detailed_translations.english: if you are obliged to do something, you have to do it because the situation, the law, a duty etc makes it necessary

name: shears
trans: n. 大剪刀；剪切机；剪下的东西（shear的复数） v. 剪切；割去；横越（shear的第三人称单数） n. (Shears)人名；(英、塞拉)希尔斯

name: spare
trans: adj. 额外的，备用的；多余的；瘦高的，瘦长的；简朴的；未装饰的；空闲的；少量的；节约的 v. 饶恕；不伤害；不毁坏；使避免；（尤指在自己困难的情况下）抽出，匀出；剩下；分让；节约；吝惜；删节 n. 备用品；（汽车或其他设备的）备用零件，配件；（十柱保龄球戏中的）二击全倒 n. (Spare)（美、英、瑞典、加、拉脱维亚、印、法）史琶尔（人名）

sentences.english: Sorry, I can’t spare the time.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我抽不出时间。

sentences.english: Have you got any spare boxes?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有多余的盒子？

sentences.english: You could sleep in the spare bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 你可以睡那间空着的客房。

sentences.english: Do you have any spare cash?
sentences.chinese: 你手头有闲钱吗？

sentences.english: I’ll go and see if there are any spare seats.
sentences.chinese: 我去看看是否还有空余的座位。

sentences.english: A decline in beer sales had left the industry with spare capacity (= the ability to produce more than can be sold ) .
sentences.chinese: 啤酒销售量的下降使该行业出现产能闲置。

detailed_translations.english: to make something such as time, money, or workers available for someone, especially when this is difficult for you to do
not being used or not needed at the present time

name: check
trans: vt. 检查，核对；制止，抑制；在…上打勾；托运 vi. 核实，查核；中止；打勾；[象棋]将一军 n. 支票；制止，抑制；检验，核对 n. （英）切克（人名）

sentences.english: Check the tiles carefully before you buy them.
sentences.chinese: 购买之前要把瓷砖仔细检查一下。

sentences.english: A first rule in solving any mystery is to check the facts.
sentences.chinese: 揭开谜团的第一条规则是核查事实。

sentences.english: The police are failing to take adequate measures to check the growth in crime.
sentences.chinese: 警方未能采取适当的措施来阻止犯罪率上升。

sentences.english: Conduct regular checks on your water quality.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查水质。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in order to find out whether something really is correct, true, or in good condition
the process of finding out if something is safe, correct, true, or in the condition it should be

name: goalie
trans: n. 守门员（等于goalkeeper）

name: playoff
trans: n. 双方得分相等时的最后决赛；复赛；季后赛

sentences.english: Nick Faldo was beaten by Peter Baker in a playoff.
sentences.chinese: 尼克·福尔多在加时赛中被彼得·贝克击败。

detailed_translations.chinese: 双方得分相等时的最后决赛；复赛；季后赛
detailed_translations.english: A playoff is an extra game that is played to decide the winner of a sports competition when two or more people have the same score

name: puck
trans: n. 冰球（由硬橡胶制成）；顽皮的小妖精；（英）鼠状定位器；欧夜莺；脾脱疽 n. (Puck)人名；(德)普克

name: eclipse
trans: n. （天体的）食；日食，月食；（重要性、权势等的）黯然失色；（尤指雄鸭的）羽毛暗淡期；（交配期后不复鲜艳的）非婚羽 v. 遮住……的光；（诗、文）遮暗；（使）黯然失色

sentences.english: The economy had eclipsed the environment as an election issue.
sentences.chinese: 经济作为竞选话题已经盖过环境问题。

detailed_translations.english: to become more important, powerful, famous etc than someone or something else, so that they are no longer noticed
an occasion when the sun or the moon cannot be seen, because the Earth is passing directly between the moon and the sun, or because the moon is passing directly between the Earth and the sun

name: gravity
trans: n. 重力，地心引力；严重性；庄严

sentences.english: the force of gravity
sentences.chinese: 重力

sentences.english: I could not hide from her the gravity of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 我不能向她隐瞒情况的严重性。

detailed_translations.english: the force that causes something to fall to the ground or to be attracted to another  planet

name: revolution
trans: n. 革命；旋转；运行；循环

sentences.english: the French Revolution of 1789
sentences.chinese: 1789年法国大革命

sentences.english: the planets’ revolution around the sun
sentences.chinese: 行星围绕太阳的公转

detailed_translations.english: an attempt, by a large number of people, to change the government of a country, especially by violent action

name: rotation
trans: n. 旋转；循环，轮流

sentences.english: The rotation of flagella pushes the bacteria through the water.
sentences.chinese: 鞭毛的旋转可以推动细菌在水中行进。

sentences.english: Sets this matrix to a translation, rotation and scaling matrix.
sentences.chinese: 设置这个矩阵为一个平移、旋转和缩放矩阵。

detailed_translations.english: when something turns with a circular movement around a central point

name: tide
trans: n. 趋势，潮流；潮汐 vt. 随潮漂流

sentences.english: Is the tide going out or coming in ?
sentences.chinese: 现在是退潮还是涨潮？

sentences.english: We went for a walk and got cut off by the tide .
sentences.chinese: 我们去散步，结果被潮水困住了。

detailed_translations.english: the regular rising and falling of the level of the sea

name: integration
trans: n. 集成；综合

sentences.english: problems of racial integration
sentences.chinese: 种族融合的问题

detailed_translations.english: the combining of two or more things so that they work together effectively

name: rural
trans: adj. 农村的，乡下的；田园的，有乡村风味的

sentences.english: a rural setting
sentences.chinese: 乡村环境

sentences.english: rural bus routes
sentences.chinese: 乡村公共汽车路线

detailed_translations.english: happening in or relating to the countryside, not the city

name: debt
trans: n. 债务；借款；罪过

sentences.english: He had enough money to pay off his outstanding debts.
sentences.chinese: 他有足够的钱偿还亏欠的债务。

sentences.english: students who run up huge debts
sentences.chinese: 欠下巨额债务的学生

detailed_translations.english: a sum of money that a person or organization owes

name: income
trans: n. 收入，收益；所得

sentences.english: low-income families
sentences.chinese: 低收入家庭

detailed_translations.english: the money that you earn from your work or that you receive from investments, the government etc

name: interest
trans: n. 兴趣，爱好；利息；利益；趣味；同行 vt. 使……感兴趣；引起……的关心；使……参与

sentences.english: I watched the first few episodes, but soon lost interest.
sentences.chinese: 我看了前几集，但很快就失去了兴趣。

sentences.english: The last round of bidding aroused considerable interest.
sentences.chinese: 最后一轮竞价引起人们相当大的兴趣。

sentences.english: Our survey reveals a disturbing lack of interest in teacher training.
sentences.chinese: 我们的调查显示人们对教师培训失去了兴趣，这很令人不安。

sentences.english: I read your article with great interest.
sentences.chinese: 我兴致勃勃地拜读了您的文章。

sentences.english: to promote/protect/safeguard sb's interests
sentences.chinese: 为某人的利益游说；保护 / 维护某人的利益

sentences.english: The money was repaid with interest.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱是带息偿还的。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that you have when you want to know or learn more about sb/sth

name: loan
trans: n. 贷款；借款 vi. 借出 vt. 借；借给

sentences.english: We obtained a loan from the government.
sentences.chinese: 我们得了一笔政府贷款。

sentences.english: If you ask him for a loan, he'll come through.
sentences.chinese: 如果你向他贷款，他会满足你的要求的。

sentences.english: The company won't keep going unless we can get some loan.
sentences.chinese: 除非我们能搞到贷款，否则公司就维持不下去了。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that you borrow from a bank etc

name: terms
trans: n. 地位，关系；[法] 条款；术语；措辞；价钱（term的复数形式） v. 把…称为（term的三单形式）

sentences.english: Myocardial infarction is the medical term for a heart attack.
sentences.chinese: 心肌梗塞是心脏病发作的医学术语。

sentences.english: He had been termed a temporary employee.
sentences.chinese: 他曾被称为临时工。

detailed_translations.chinese: 地位，关系；[法] 条款；术语；措辞；价钱（term的复数形式）
detailed_translations.english: A term is a word or expression with a specific meaning, especially one which is used in relation to a particular subject
If you say that something is termed a particular thing, you mean that that is what people call it or that is their opinion of it

name: adaptation
trans: n. 适应；改编；改编本，改写本

sentences.english: Branagh won two awards for his screen adaptation of Shakespeare's Henry the Fifth.
sentences.chinese: 布拉纳因他对莎士比亚的《亨利五世》的荧幕改编而获了两次奖。

detailed_translations.chinese: 适应；改编；改编本，改写本
detailed_translations.english: a film or television programme that is based on a book or play

name: dormant
trans: adj. 休眠的；静止的；睡眠状态的；隐匿的 n. (Dormant)人名；(法)多尔芒

sentences.english: a huge dormant volcano
sentences.chinese: 一座巨大的休眠火山

detailed_translations.chinese: 休眠的；静止的；睡眠状态的；隐匿的
detailed_translations.english: not active or not growing at the present time but able to be active later

name: humid
trans: adj. 潮湿的；湿润的；多湿气的

sentences.english: Tokyo is extremely humid in mid-summer.
sentences.chinese: 仲夏的东京十分潮湿。

detailed_translations.english: if the weather is humid, you feel uncomfortable because the air is very wet and usually hot

name: precipitation
trans: n. [化学] 沉淀，[化学] 沉淀物；降水；冰雹；坠落；鲁莽

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 沉淀，[化学] 沉淀物；降水；冰雹；坠落；鲁莽
detailed_translations.english: rain, snow etc that falls on the ground, or the amount of rain, snow etc that falls

name: temperate
trans: adj. 温和的；适度的；有节制的

sentences.english: The Nile Valley keeps a temperate climate throughout the year.
sentences.chinese: 尼罗河流域全年气候温和。

detailed_translations.chinese: 温和的；适度的；有节制的
detailed_translations.english: behaviour that is temperate is calm and sensible

name: artifact
trans: n. 人工制品，手工艺品；非自然存在物体（artefact 的另一种拼法）

sentences.english: In the wrong hands this powerful artifact has the ability to unravel the soul.
sentences.chinese: 在错误手这强有力的人工制品有能力解开灵魂。

name: excavate
trans: vt. 挖掘；开凿 vi. 发掘；细查

sentences.english: Schliemann excavated the ancient city of Troy.
sentences.chinese: 谢里曼发掘出特洛伊古城。

detailed_translations.english: if a scientist or archaeologist excavates an area of land, they dig carefully to find ancient objects, bones etc

name: immigrant
trans: adj. 移民的；迁入的 n. 移民，侨民

sentences.english: an illegal immigrant
sentences.chinese: 非法移民

sentences.english: a new wave of immigrants from the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 来自中东的一股新兴的移民浪潮

detailed_translations.english: someone who enters another country to live there permanently

name: mural
trans: n. 壁画 adj. （似）墙的，与墙有关的；（与）体腔壁有关的

sentences.english: Pour a little glue into some shallow containers, dip cotton balls in the glue and then stick onto the paper - you have a snow mural!
sentences.chinese: 在一个浅的容器里倒一点胶水，用棉球沾点胶水然后粘到纸上——你就有了幅雪景壁饰！

sentences.english: This work is clearly connected with The Last Supper: the Christ has the same ethereal and elusive quality as the faded figure at the centre of Leonardo's sublime mural.
sentences.chinese: 这幅画显然和《最后的晚餐》有某种关联：画中的基督，和达·芬奇最伟大的壁画中心那已褪色的基督形象一样，同样空灵缥缈。

detailed_translations.english: a painting that is painted on a wall, either inside or outside a building

name: shrine
trans: n. 圣地；神殿；神龛；圣祠 vt. 将…置于神龛内；把…奉为神圣

sentences.english: Elvis’ home has become a shrine for his fans.
sentences.chinese: 猫王的故居成了歌迷的朝圣地。

detailed_translations.english: a place that is connected with a holy event or holy person, and that people visit to pray

detailed_translations.chinese: 将…置于神龛内；把…奉为神圣

name: bulbous
trans: adj. 球根的；球根状的；由球根生长的（等于bulbaceous）

sentences.english: Design travelers will dig the big, bulbous lamps that hang from the ceiling over leather seats and carefully-placed table settings.
sentences.chinese: 这些设计使得游客会欣赏那些大大的从天花板垂下并悬于皮椅之上的球根状灯饰和精心设计的餐桌摆设。

detailed_translations.chinese: 球根的， 球根状的， 球根长成的

name: flail
trans: v. 乱动；（用棍棒）猛击；（使）大幅波动；踉跄；用连枷打（谷） n. 连枷（旧时打谷物用的工具）

sentences.english: I wield the flail of the lashing hail, And whiten the green plains under.
sentences.chinese: 我挥动冰雹的连枷，把绿色的原野捶打得有如银装素裹；

sentences.english: Danilo galloped up in silence, holding a drawn dagger in his left hand, and thrashing the heaving sides of his chestnut horse with his riding whip, as though it were a flail.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼洛默不作声地疾驰，左手中持着一柄拔出的短剑，像用连枷打谷似的用那条短柄长鞭抽打着栗色大马的收缩进去的两肋。

detailed_translations.english: to beat someone or something violently, usually with a stick
a tool consisting of a stick that swings from a long handle, used in the past to separate grain from wheat by beating it

name: heave
trans: vt. 举起；使起伏；投掷；恶心；发出（叹息等） vi. 起伏；举起；喘息；呕吐 n. 举起；起伏；投掷；一阵呕吐

sentences.english: Michael’s shoulders heaved with silent laughter.
sentences.chinese: 迈克尔憋着不笑出声来，双肩直抖。

sentences.english: The sea heaved up and down beneath the boat.
sentences.chinese: 船的下面大海波涛汹涌。

detailed_translations.english: to move up and down with very strong movements

detailed_translations.chinese: 举起，提起，拉起，拖；扔；发出
detailed_translations.english: to pull or lift something very heavy with one great effort

detailed_translations.chinese: 举起； 起伏， 升降
detailed_translations.english: a strong rising or falling movement

name: lurk
trans: vi. 潜伏；潜藏；埋伏 n. 潜伏；埋伏

sentences.english: a dark formless danger, lurking in the shadows
sentences.chinese: 一种潜藏在阴影里的无形危险

detailed_translations.english: to wait somewhere quietly and secretly, usually because you are going to do something wrong

name: vault
trans: n. 拱顶；撑竿跳；地下室 vi. 跳跃；成穹状弯曲 vt. 做成圆拱形；撑竿跳过

sentences.english: The robber vaulted over the counter and took $200 in cash.
sentences.chinese: 抢劫犯跃过柜台，抢走了200美元现金。

detailed_translations.english: a roof or ceiling that consists of several arches that are joined together, especially in a church
to jump over something in one movement, using your hands or a pole to help you

name: weave
trans: vt. 编织；编排；使迂回前进 vi. 纺织；编成；迂回行进 n. 织物；织法；编织式样

sentences.english: hand-woven scarves
sentences.chinese: 手织围巾

sentences.english: Only a few of the women still weave.
sentences.chinese: 只有数量很少的妇女还在编织。

sentences.english: traditional basket weaving
sentences.chinese: 传统的编篮技术

detailed_translations.chinese: 迂回行进；编织；编造，编纂
detailed_translations.english: to make cloth, a carpet, a basket etc by crossing threads or thin pieces under and over each other by hand or on a loom
the way in which a material is woven, and the pattern formed by this

name: apprenticeship
trans: n. 学徒期；学徒身分

sentences.english: He’s serving an apprenticeship as a printer.
sentences.chinese: 他现在是一名印刷工学徒。

sentences.english: a five-year apprenticeship
sentences.chinese: 五年学徒期

detailed_translations.english: the job of being an apprentice, or the period of time in which you are an apprentice

name: filament
trans: n. 灯丝；细丝；细线；单纤维

sentences.english: The effect is caused by the escape of electrons from the hot filament .
sentences.chinese: 这个效应是由于电子从热灯丝逸出而引起的。

sentences.english: An inert gas such as argon is introduced to reduce evaporation of the filament .
sentences.chinese: 将诸如氩那样的惰性气体充入灯泡中，以减少灯丝的蒸发。

sentences.english: In the paper, the enhancing process of diamond nucleation by negative substrate bias in hot filament CVD system was analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 对利用热灯丝CVD沉积金刚石膜时负衬底偏压增强金刚石的核化过程进行了分析。

detailed_translations.english: A filament is a very thin piece or thread of something, for example, the piece of wire inside a light bulb

name: invent
trans: vt. 发明；创造；虚构

sentences.english: Alexander Graham Bell invented the telephone in 1876.
sentences.chinese: 亚历山大 · 格雷厄姆 · 贝尔于1876年发明了电话。

detailed_translations.english: to make, design, or think of a new type of thing

name: manufacture
trans: n. 制造；产品；制造业 vt. 制造；加工；捏造 vi. 制造

sentences.english: the company that manufactured the drug
sentences.chinese: 生产这种药的公司

sentences.english: manufactured goods
sentences.chinese: 工业品，制成品

sentences.english: Cost will determine the methods of manufacture.
sentences.chinese: 成本将决定生产方法。

sentences.english: a major importer of cotton manufactures
sentences.chinese: 棉花产品的主要进口商

detailed_translations.english: to use machines to make goods or materials, usually in large numbers or amounts
the process of making goods or materials using machines, usually in large numbers or amounts

name: archaeology
trans: n. 考古学 考古学的

sentences.english: He specializes in archaeology.
sentences.chinese: 他专修考古学。

sentences.english: In my recent research, I found that all three come together and, what is more, they help me to show that archaeology has relevance – it is not just old stones and bones.
sentences.chinese: 我在最近的研究中发现，这三点综合发生着作用，除此之外，它们也帮助我发现考古学的重要意义，它不仅仅意味着一堆石头和骨头。

sentences.english: "There was no access to clean water, there was no access to basic education especially in the rural areas where the archaeology was," she says.
sentences.chinese: 在那里的考古学特别是农村地区，我们并没有获得干净的水，有没有基本的教育的机会，“她说。

detailed_translations.english: the study of ancient societies by examining what remains of their buildings,  grave s  , tools etc

name: blog
trans: n. 网络日志，博客 v. 写博客

sentences.english: When Barbieux started his blog, his aspirations were small; he simply hoped to communicate with a few people.
sentences.chinese: 当巴布开始他的博客时，他的期望并不大。他只是希望能与几个人交流。

detailed_translations.english: a web page containing information or opinions from a particular person or about a particular subject, to which new information is added regularly

name: expedition
trans: n. 远征；探险队；迅速
