sentences.english: an expedition to the North Pole
sentences.chinese: 北极探险

sentences.english: another Qomolangma expedition
sentences.chinese: 又一次珠穆朗玛峰探险

detailed_translations.english: a long and carefully organized journey, especially to a dangerous or unfamiliar place, or the people that make this journey

name: research
trans: n. 研究；调查 vi. 研究；调查 vt. 研究；调查 [ 过去式 researched 过去分词 researched 现在分词 researching ]

sentences.english: It’s a good idea to do some research before you buy a house.
sentences.chinese: 买房子之前作些了解，这想法很对。

sentences.english: Gould was helped in his researches by local naturalists.
sentences.chinese: 古尔德在研究过程中得到了当地博物学家的帮助。

sentences.english: He’s been researching material for a documentary.
sentences.chinese: 他一直在研究材料，准备做一个纪录片。

detailed_translations.english: the activity of finding information about something that you are interested in or need to know about
to study a subject in detail, especially in order to discover new facts or test new ideas

name: alpine
trans: adj. 阿尔卑斯山的，高山的

sentences.english: breathtaking alpine scenery
sentences.chinese: 令人叹为观止的阿尔卑斯山风景

sentences.english: alpine flowers
sentences.chinese: 高山花卉

sentences.english: alpine skiing
sentences.chinese: 高山滑雪

detailed_translations.chinese: 高山的, 阿尔卑斯山的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the Alps (=  a mountain range in central Europe  ) or to mountains in general

name: remoteness
trans: n. 遥远；偏僻；细微；时间久远

sentences.english: Its development represents man's triumph over remoteness and a harsh landscape.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚的发展，是人类战胜遥远和荒芜的成果。

sentences.english: And such abstractness means remoteness and throws us back once more upon teaching and learning as mere means of getting ready for an end disconnected from the means.
sentences.chinese: 这种抽象性又意味著遥远而不切实际，这样又使我们返回到把教和学仅仅作为准备达到和它无关的目的的一种手段。

sentences.english: We need to recognize that wilderness areas, which we've foolishly considered to be de-facto protected due to their remoteness, is actually being dramatically lost around the world.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要了解荒野地区的重要性，要知道它们在世界上正在大幅减少，否则我们会愚蠢地认为，对荒野地区的保护是由于其地处偏远。

name: dwelling
trans: n. 住处；寓所 v. 居住（dwell的现在分词）

sentences.english: Some 3,500 new dwellings are planned for the area.
sentences.chinese: 大约三千五百套新住宅计划在这个地区新建。

detailed_translations.english: a house, apartment etc where people live

name: engineering
trans: n. 工程，工程学 v. 设计；管理（engineer的ing形式）；建造

sentences.english: The bridge is a triumph of modern engineering.
sentences.chinese: 这座桥是现代工程的一大成就。

sentences.english: a degree in engineering
sentences.chinese: 工程学学位

detailed_translations.english: the activity of applying scientific knowledge to the design, building and control of machines, roads, bridges, electrical equipment, etc.

name: subterranean
trans: adj. 地下的；秘密的；隐蔽的 n. 地下工作者

sentences.english: subterranean passage
sentences.chinese: 地下通道

detailed_translations.english: beneath the surface of the earth

name: federation
trans: n. 联合；联邦；联盟；联邦政府

sentences.english: the National Federation of Women’s Institutes
sentences.chinese: 〔英国及英联邦国家〕妇女协会全国联合会

detailed_translations.chinese: 联合；联邦；联盟；联邦政府
detailed_translations.english: a group of organizations, clubs, or people that have joined together to form a single group

name: fertile
trans: adj. 富饶的，肥沃的；能生育的

sentences.english: the product of a fertile imagination
sentences.chinese: 想象力丰富的产物

detailed_translations.english: (of a person's mind or imagination) that produces a lot of new ideas

name: independence
trans: n. 独立性，自立性；自主

sentences.english: The country has made great advances since independence.
sentences.chinese: 该国自独立以来发展迅速。

detailed_translations.chinese: 独立； 自主； 自立
detailed_translations.english: political freedom from control by the government of another country

name: peninsula
trans: n. 半岛

sentences.english: the Korean peninsula
sentences.chinese: 朝鲜半岛

detailed_translations.english: a piece of land almost completely surrounded by water but joined to a large area of land

name: armistice
trans: n. 停战，休战；休战协议

name: casualty
trans: n. 意外事故；伤亡人员；急诊室

sentences.english: We have had our first casualty. One runner has dropped out with cramp.
sentences.chinese: 我们有了第一位伤员，有一位队员因腿部痉挛退出了。

sentences.english: Any history of bombing must also be a history of civilian casualty, for bombing saves the lives of soldiers only at the expense of other lives.
sentences.chinese: 任何空袭的历史也必定是平民伤亡的历史，因为空袭救了士兵的性命只能以其他人的生命为代价。

sentences.english: The first item always on that was the overnight casualty report from Iraq and Afghanistan, and I would often come and see that had been circled by the president or that he would be reflecting on that.
sentences.chinese: 上面的第一条永远是,这一晚在伊拉克和阿富汗,士兵的伤亡报告，我来的时候会看到那条消息,被布什总统圈了出来,他看着报告会陷入沉思。

name: civilian
trans: n. 平民，百姓 adj. 民用的，百姓的，平民的

sentences.english: Many innocent civilians were killed during the war.
sentences.chinese: 许多无辜的平民在战争中丧生。

sentences.english: It was difficult to return to civilian life after ten years in the military.
sentences.chinese: 从军十年后重新过平民生活不容易。

detailed_translations.english: anyone who is not a member of the military forces or the police
used to describe people or things that are not military

name: combat
trans: n. 战斗；搏斗；争论，反对 v. 与……战斗；防止，抑制（尤用于新闻报道） adj. 战斗的；为……斗争的 n. (Combat) （法）孔巴（人名）

sentences.english: In the case of this battle, the combat did only last a singleday.
sentences.chinese: 在译成战役的情况下，这场战斗仅仅持续了短短的一天。

sentences.english: We will remove our combat brigades from Iraq by the end of next summer, and all of our troops by the end of 2011.
sentences.chinese: 我们会在明年夏末从伊拉克撤回我们的战斗旅，在2011年末，我们所有军队都将从伊拉克撤出。

sentences.english: These people would then be given training in vigilance and combat not just to defend themselves but also the borders.
sentences.chinese: 这些人会被提供警戒和战斗训练，不仅是为了保护自己，而且要保护边界安全。

detailed_translations.english: fighting, especially during a war

name: recognition
trans: n. 识别；承认，认出；重视；赞誉；公认

sentences.english: He stared at her, but there was no sign of recognition .
sentences.chinese: 他盯着她看，但似乎没认出她来。

detailed_translations.english: the act of knowing someone or something because you have known or learned about them in the past

name: sacrifice
trans: n. 牺牲；祭品；供奉 vt. 牺牲；献祭；亏本出售 vi. 献祭；奉献

sentences.english: The minister stressed the need for economic sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 部长强调了在经济上作出牺牲的必要性。

sentences.english: The workforce were willing to make sacrifices in order to preserve jobs.
sentences.chinese: 雇员为了保住饭碗情愿作出牺牲。

sentences.english: She brought three children up single-handedly, often at great personal sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 她独自一人把三个孩子带大，常常需要作出巨大的个人牺牲。

sentences.english: They made sacrifices to ensure a good harvest.
sentences.chinese: 他们举行献祭以保丰收。

sentences.english: He sacrificed a promising career to look after his kids.
sentences.chinese: 他为了照看孩子牺牲了很有前途的事业。

detailed_translations.english: when you decide not to have something valuable, in order to get something that is more important
to willingly stop having something you want or doing something you like in order to get something more important

name: engulf
trans: vt. 吞没；吞食，狼吞虎咽

sentences.english: despair so great it threatened to engulf him
sentences.chinese: 几乎要将他压垮的绝望情绪

detailed_translations.english: if an unpleasant feeling engulfs you, you feel it very strongly

name: hearth
trans: n. 灶台；炉边；炉床；壁炉地面 n. (Hearth)人名；(英)哈思

sentences.english: It was winter and there was a huge fire roaring in the hearth.
sentences.chinese: 时值冬天，壁炉里的炉火在熊熊燃烧。

detailed_translations.english: the area of floor around a fireplace in a house

name: menacing
trans: adj. 威胁的；险恶的 v. 威胁（menace的ing形式）；恐吓

sentences.english: dark menacing clouds
sentences.chinese: 可怕的乌云

sentences.english: a low menacing laugh
sentences.chinese: 带威胁的低声一笑

sentences.english: His tone grew more menacing.
sentences.chinese: 他的语气越来越可怕。

detailed_translations.english: making you expect something unpleasant

name: quaint
trans: adj. 古雅的；奇怪的；离奇有趣的；做得很精巧的

sentences.english: ...a small, quaint town with narrow streets and traditional half-timbered houses.
sentences.chinese: …一座古朴的小镇，有着狭窄的街道和传统的半木制房屋。

detailed_translations.chinese: 古雅的；奇怪的；离奇有趣的；做得很精巧的
detailed_translations.english: Something that is quaint is attractive because it is old-fashioned

name: scorch
trans: vt. 烧焦；使枯萎；挖苦 vi. 烧焦；枯萎 n. 烧焦；焦痕

sentences.english: The walls had been blackened and scorched by fire.
sentences.chinese: 这些墙被大火熏黑了。

detailed_translations.english: if you scorch something, or if it scorches, its surface burns slightly and changes colour
a mark made on something where its surface has been burnt

name: artificial
trans: adj. 人造的；仿造的；虚伪的；非原产地的；武断的

sentences.english: artificial flowers
sentences.chinese: 假花

sentences.english: artificial light
sentences.chinese: 人造光

sentences.english: artificial fertilizers
sentences.chinese: 化肥

detailed_translations.english: not real or not made of natural things but made to be like something that is real or natural

name: drain
trans: v. 排水；流干；喝光；（感情）变淡；使精疲力竭；（非正式）将（球）轻击入穴 n. 排水沟；下水道；负担；消耗 n. (Drain) （美、英、法、加）德兰（人名）

sentences.english: He flushed the drain.
sentences.chinese: 他用水冲排水沟。

sentences.english: The boat drifted helplessly along the drain until some people saw him.
sentences.chinese: 船儿无助地顺着排水沟漂流直到有人看见他。

detailed_translations.english: something that continuously uses a lot of time, money etc

name: isthmus
trans: n. 地峡；管峡

name: reclaim
trans: vt. 开拓；回收再利用；改造某人，使某人悔改 vi. 抗议，喊叫 n. 改造，感化；再生胶

sentences.english: You may be entitled to reclaim some tax.
sentences.chinese: 你也许可以享受一定额度的退税。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开拓；回收再利用；改造某人，使某人悔改
detailed_translations.english: to get back an amount of money that you have paid

name: seaport
trans: n. 海港；港口都市

sentences.english: ...the Baltic seaport of Rostock.
sentences.chinese: ...波罗的海沿岸的海港城市罗斯托克。

detailed_translations.english: a large town on or near a coast, with a harbour that big ships can use

name: stilt
trans: n. 高跷；支柱，支撑物 vt. 使踏上高跷

sentences.english: When holidays came, there were Yangko and stilt shows with people eager to participate.
sentences.chinese: 过节时会有扭秧歌、踩高跷表演，人们也都乐意参加。

sentences.english: The most noteworthy features of mangrove forests, apart from their unique habitat, are: the relative paucity of the species comprising them; the arch-formed stilt roots of the Rhizophora spp.;
sentences.chinese: 除了其独特的生境以外， 红树林最令人注意的特征是构成红树林的品种比较单一； Rhizophora 品种的拱形高跷根系；其它属的悬空根系团或呼吸根，如 Avicennia 和 Sonneratia。

detailed_translations.english: one of two poles which you can stand on and walk high above the ground

name: artisan
trans: n. 工匠，技工

sentences.english: That allowed England to harness the creative potential of its artisan classes in a way that no other country had managed before.
sentences.chinese: 如此，使得英国得以在某种程度上利用本国工匠阶层创造性潜能产生巨大的能量，此为他国以前没有做到之事。

sentences.english: All of it appeared to be handmade, probably by a 17th century artisan.
sentences.chinese: 这里的一切似乎都是手工制作的，很可能出自一位17世纪工匠之手。

sentences.english: That would certainly not be true of the members of the artisan class or the military class for that reason.
sentences.chinese: 那对工匠阶级,与军人阶级,绝对不可能为真。

detailed_translations.english: someone who does skilled work, making things with their hands

name: mechanize
trans: vt. 使机械化；机动化；用机械装置

sentences.english: Only gradually are technologies being developed to mechanize the task.
sentences.chinese: 渐渐地科技才发展到能使这项任务机械化。

detailed_translations.english: If someone mechanizes a process, they cause it to be done by a machine or machines, when it was previously done by people

name: motif
trans: n. 主题；动机；主旨；图形；意念

sentences.english: The theme of creation is a recurrent motif in Celtic mythology.
sentences.chinese: 天地万物的创造是凯尔特神话中反复出现的主题。

detailed_translations.english: an idea, subject, or image that is regularly repeated and developed in a book, film, work of art etc

name: warp
trans: n. 弯曲，歪曲；偏见；乖戾 vt. 使变形；使有偏见；曲解 vi. 变歪，变弯；曲解

sentences.english: The door must be warped. It won’t close properly.
sentences.chinese: 这门肯定是变形了，关不严。

detailed_translations.english: a part of something that has become bent or twisted from its original shape
if something warps, or if heat or cold warps it, it becomes bent or twisted, and loses its original shape

name: weft
trans: n. 纬线；信号旗

sentences.english: Usage: This detector is applied to plastic looms for stopping operation in case of broken weft and weft-out. It is composed of signal emitter, receiver and controller.
sentences.chinese: 用途：本检测器用于塑料园织机在断纬、完纬时控制主机停车之功能。它由信号发射器， 信号接收器和控制器三部分组成。

name: clarifier
trans: n. [食品] 澄清器

name: digester
trans: n. （化）蒸煮器，煮解器；做摘要者，汇编者

name: sewage
trans: n. 污水；下水道；污物

sentences.english: Chlorine is used in sewage treatment.
sentences.chinese: 氯被用于污水处理。

sentences.english: The factory secretly dumped millions of gallons of raw sewage (= sewage that had not been treated ) into the Ohio river.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂偷偷地把几百万加仑未经处理的污水排放进了俄亥俄河。

detailed_translations.english: the mixture of waste from the human body and used water, that is carried away from houses by pipes under the ground

name: ambassador
trans: n. 大使；代表；使节

sentences.english: the US ambassador to Spain
sentences.chinese: 美国驻西班牙大使

detailed_translations.english: an important official who represents his or her government in a foreign country

name: incubator
trans: n. （用于体弱婴儿或早产儿护理的）恒温箱，保育箱；孵化器；细菌培养器；微生物培养器；（新兴小企业的）孵化基地（常配有后勤人员及设备，租金低廉）

sentences.english: a high-tech incubator on the east coast
sentences.chinese: 位于东海岸的高科技企业扶持机构

detailed_translations.chinese: [禽] 孵卵器；[儿科] 保温箱；早产儿保育器；细菌培养器
detailed_translations.english: a piece of hospital equipment into which very small or weak babies are put to keep them alive and warm

name: urban
trans: adj. 城市的；住在都市的 n. (Urban)人名；(西)乌尔万；(斯洛伐)乌尔班；(德、俄、罗、匈、塞、波、捷、瑞典、意)乌尔班；(英)厄本；(法)于尔邦

sentences.english: unemployment in urban areas
sentences.chinese: 城市地区的失业状况

sentences.english: the deprived sections of the urban population
sentences.chinese: 城市人口中的贫困群体

detailed_translations.english: relating to towns and cities

name: volunteer
trans: n. 志愿者；志愿兵 adj. 志愿的 vi. 自愿 vt. 自愿

sentences.english: Most of the relief work was done by volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 大部分救援工作都由志愿人员完成。

sentences.english: I volunteered my services as a driver.
sentences.chinese: 我主动提出来当司机。

detailed_translations.english: someone who does a job willingly without being paid
to offer to do something without expecting any reward, often something that other people do not want to do

name: coveted
trans: adj. 垂涎的；梦寐以求的 v. 垂涎；渴望（covet的过去分词形式）；贪图

name: doubles
trans: n. 双打；[矿业] 双粒级煤；复制品（double的复数） v. 使加倍；复制；折叠（double的三单形式） n. (Doubles)人名；(英)道布尔斯

name: match
trans: n. 火柴；比赛，竞赛；对手；相配的人（或物）；（计算机）匹配；配合；搭配；相似的东西；婚姻；配偶 v. 相配，相称；相似；与……成对；配对；敌得过，比得上；使等同于；使……对应；满足；与……竞争；结婚

sentences.english: It’s our last match of the season.
sentences.chinese: 这是我们本赛季最后一场比赛。

sentences.english: They’re preparing for a big match tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 他们在为明天的一场大赛做准备。

sentences.english: McClaire’s goal earned him the title of man of the match (= the person in a team who plays best ) .
sentences.chinese: 麦克莱尔的进球为他赢得了“本场最佳球员”的称号。

sentences.english: Carlos was no match for the champion.
sentences.chinese: 卡洛斯根本不是冠军的对手。

detailed_translations.english: an organized sports event between two teams or people

name: singles
trans: n. （常用复数）单打比赛；（美）独身者；单程票（single的复数） v. 挑出（single的第三人称单数形式）

name: tournament
trans: n. 锦标赛，联赛；比赛

sentences.english: She is aching to join in the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 她渴望参加比赛。

sentences.english: They dropped two games in a row and were eliminated from the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 他们在划船比赛中输了两场比赛，并被淘汰出局。

sentences.english: It's no use egging him on; he's made up his mind not to join in the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 他已拿定主意不参加比赛了，你再将他也没有用。

name: collection
trans: n. 采集，聚集；[税收] 征收；收藏品；募捐

sentences.english: a stamp collection
sentences.chinese: 一批邮票收藏品

sentences.english: a computerized data collection system
sentences.chinese: 计算机化的数据收集系统

detailed_translations.english: a group of objects, often of the same sort, that have been collected

name: communication
trans: n. 通讯，[通信] 通信；交流；信函

sentences.english: Radio was the pilot’s only means of communication.
sentences.chinese: 无线电是飞行员唯一的通信手段。

sentences.english: There has been a breakdown in communication (= failure to communicate ) .
sentences.chinese: 沟通失败。

sentences.english: Paris has good communications with many European cities.
sentences.chinese: 巴黎与许多欧洲城市之间交通便捷。

detailed_translations.english: the process by which people exchange information or express their thoughts and feelings

name: document
trans: n. 文件，公文；[计] 文档；证件 vt. 记录，记载

sentences.english: She produces legal documents for a downtown Seattle law firm.
sentences.chinese: 她为西雅图市区的一家法律事务所撰写法律文件。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper that has official information on it
to write about something, film it, or take photographs of it, in order to record information about it

name: exhibit
trans: vt. 展览；显示；提出（证据等） n. 展览品；证据；展示会 vi. 展出；开展览会

sentences.english: Her paintings have been exhibited all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 她的绘画作品在世界各地展出。

detailed_translations.english: to show something in a public place so that people can go to see it
something, for example a painting, that is put in a public place so that people can go to see it

name: preserve
trans: vt. 保存；保护；维持；腌；禁猎 n. 保护区；禁猎地；加工成的食品；（某人或群体的）专门活动

sentences.english: We must encourage the planting of new trees and preserve our existing woodlands.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须鼓励栽种新树木，同时也要保护现有的林地。

detailed_translations.english: to save something or someone from being harmed or destroyed

name: gorge
trans: n. 峡谷；胃；暴食；咽喉；障碍物 vt. 使吃饱；吞下；使扩张 vi. 拚命吃；狼吞虎咽 n. (Gorge)人名；(西)戈赫；(法)戈尔热

sentences.english: I could spend each day gorging on chocolate.
sentences.chinese: 我可以将每一天都花在狂吃巧克力上。

detailed_translations.english: If you gorge on something or gorge yourself on it, you eat lots of it in a very greedy way
a deep narrow valley with steep sides

name: mission
trans: n. 使命，任务；代表团；布道 vt. 派遣；向……传教

sentences.english: He was sent on over 200 missions before being killed in action.
sentences.chinese: 在阵亡之前他奉命执行过200多次军事任务。

sentences.english: US troops taking part in the peacekeeping mission
sentences.chinese: 参与维和任务的美军

sentences.english: a British trade mission to Moscow
sentences.chinese: 派往莫斯科的英国贸易代表团

detailed_translations.english: an important job that involves travelling somewhere, done by a member of the air force, army etc, or by a spacecraft

name: rant
trans: v. 咆哮，叫嚷；大声抱怨；夸夸其谈 n. 咆哮；激昂的长篇演说；豪言壮语 n. (Rant) （美）兰特（人名）

sentences.english: As the boss began to rant, I stood up and went out.
sentences.chinese: 老板开始咆哮时，我站起来走了出去。

sentences.english: Even their three dogs got bored and fell asleep as he ranted on.
sentences.chinese: 甚至他们的3条狗在他不停地夸夸其谈时，都觉得厌烦并睡着了。

sentences.english: "Let's get it over and done with," he ranted.
sentences.chinese: “让我们就此了结这件事情，”他咆哮道。

sentences.english: Part I is a rant against organized religion.
sentences.chinese: 第一部分是对有组织的宗教的怒斥。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone rants, you mean that they talk loudly or angrily, and exaggerate or say foolish things
Rant is also a noun

name: resourceful
trans: adj. 资源丰富的；足智多谋的；机智的

sentences.english: a woman who is energetic and resourceful
sentences.chinese: 精力充沛且足智多谋的女人

detailed_translations.english: good at finding ways of dealing with practical problems

name: wince
trans: vi. 畏缩，退避 n. 畏缩；脸部肌肉的抽搐 n. (Wince)人名；(英)温斯

sentences.english: Who smile and frown, wince and hiss.
sentences.chinese: 他们微笑和皱眉，畏缩与嘶嘘。

sentences.english: We all wince at the thought of how Xerox utterly failed to innovate on PARC's inventions, allowing Apple and Microsoft to run away with most of them.
sentences.chinese: 我们都退避在想到施乐如何完全的失败再帕洛阿尔托研究中心的发明，允许苹果和微软从他们这儿逃走。

sentences.english: And for the leaders in Bejing to shrink and wince and draw back in the presence of these individuals and their ideas sends a clear message.
sentences.chinese: 北京的领导人对他们的催促显的畏畏缩缩，并不让这些人抛头露面，政府的以对理念给外界发出了一个清晰的信号。

detailed_translations.english: to suddenly feel very uncomfortable or embarrassed because of something that happens, something you remember etc
